Reviews.Title: “5* hotel, great location in TST”
Reviews.Author: MiloMama75
Reviews.Content: The hotel was chosen based on the positive reviews on tripadvisor. Upon check-in, we were pleased to find rooms which were large, clean and comfortable. The bathrooms were spacious and well-designed (separate shower and bath). Staff were polite and friendly. The best thing about staying in this hotel would be its location - in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui, connected to the MTR station through the K11 mall exits... within a short walking distance to the shopping belt of TST. The hotel is also near to some local restaurants and eateries, great for us when we wanted to grab a bite.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and a great location”
Reviews.Author: sweetz_21_83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here four nights and had a very enjoyable stay. The beds are the typical Asian firm. The room was larger than we expected after hearing how small hong kong hotel rooms are and the bathroom was huge. The location was perfect with the mtr station right outside. The neighborhood seemed very safe, we never felt insecure and there were people out pretty much all times of day. Its a little pricey but I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Spuntz
Reviews.Content: We were staying at the Hyatt twice for 5 days and it was great - we had connecting rooms with our kids, a lovely view to hong Kong Island and just a nice stay. The staff was very helpful and friendly!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: Andrew M
Reviews.Content: If you want a 5 star hotel with a great location you can't go wrong with the Hyatt in TST. I lived in Hong Kong for 16 years then came back to visit friends and was very impressed by the hotel. Get a harbour view room if your budget allows it. The breakfast is stunning you just cant go past it, possibly the best breakfast buffet I have had in many years of travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Better than you think”
Reviews.Author: sbp0713
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Kowloon is one of the best hotels in Hong Kong. If you can get access to the Regency Club on top it even adds to the experience. The food is excellent and so is the staff. Very near MTR and shopping of all varieties. Can be competitively priced on a pre-paid rate.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Fael
Reviews.Content: The stand-out aspect of my stay in August 2012 was the service staff -- well trained, efficient, genuine. Staff members briskly packed my breakfast (but were very good about it) as I was running late on one of the mornings, and also helped me check-out in record time as I had to catch a flight due to last minute change in my schedule - even carrying my luggage and running with me to the taxi! Rooms were clean, with all the usual amenities. Location-wise, it's ideally situated in Kowloon with easy access to the MTR through the shopping mall and has a free shuttle bus service to the ICC, where our offices are. The open-air pool is good enough on the 8th floor. Wide choice of selection for breakfast. One slightly unfortunate thing though was that the guests (sounded like it could be a family with kids) in adjacent rooms were very noisy, banging furniture around for a couple of nights, although in all fairness the soundproofing for the hotel was not too shabby.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: BeachGuru1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was situated ideally - right by the East Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station and only 5 minutes from the wharf, but it was also attractive because it had a swimming pool. The rooms were clean and spacious and we really liked them. Our only slight gripe was that the gorgeous swimming pool was closed for 4 out of the 5 days we were there. Apparently some glass had broken in a window above, but we couldn't use it (and it took a while for them to tell us the reason). However, they did pay for us to go and use the lovely pool in the Grand Hyatt in Mong Kok, for which were very grateful. Apart from that, the hotel was ideal for us and I would go back there again!

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Kowloon, close to Mody Rd. and the Warf.”
Reviews.Author: pekopper
Reviews.Content: Fine hotel, great location. Breakfast area has a wide selection of food, many stations spread through out the dining area, almost too spread out! Good food, good choices. Rooms are spacious and very clean. Good bathroom facilities. Close to Shopping and the Star Ferry as well as the underground trains and subways.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in TST!”
Reviews.Author: Riverz12
Reviews.Content: My second time staying in this hotel. This trip was for 4 nights. Very clean, great service, updated rooms and centrally located in TST. My only 2 gripes are that it's one of the few hotels that charges for Internet and the lobby isnt ideal for meetings or business. Price was competitive. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: tonykowalewski
Reviews.Content: I travel a couple of times each year to HK on business and have tried many hotels. This however, is by far the best value I have found so far in four years of trying. Service is prompt and attentive. The quality of food in the Chinese restaurant is phenomenal. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: gokhanHk
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a club room with harbor view . Small room Modern decoration but nothing special. I found nOthing bad at hotel but also nothing extraordinary . It is a standard Hyatt regency without any magic touch . Service is good , everything in Hyatt standard quality, no surprises

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Here Again in a Heartbeat.”
Reviews.Author: MoochAdelaide
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay in Hong Kong, and each time it gets so much better! On each occasion we have stayed in different hotels in Tsim Sha Tsui but this is the one we will return to! Fantastic, friendly and interested staff together with clean, impressive, modern rooms combined to make our stay one to remember. The breakfasts were certainly our highlight! Wonderful selection and choice, attentive, polite staff and a great atmosphere. The location for us was also excellent. Close to the MTR, walking distance to Nathan Road and Ocean Terminal. A terrific hotel experience. Undoubtedly, we will return to Hong Kong and the Hyatt Regency Tsim Sha Tsui will most certainly be our hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: KPinJapan
Reviews.Content: Great location for sight seeing and shopping. Easy access to the train station. Rooms were excellent and the service was top notch. This was my first trip to Hong Kong so I cannot compare to other hotels in the area. But I see no reason to look else where for future visits!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Barry T
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here in May. The staff was friendly, helpful, but in a refined unobtrusive way - very Hyatt. I had a harbor view room on a high floor - loved the view - day and night. The Regency Club was a perfect escape for breakfast and a great way to end the day. As a Hyatt Diamond member - I appreciated the attention to detail of the Hong Kong Tsim Sha Tsui. I will be back in February and and looking forward to exploring Hong Kong with the Hyatt as my base!

Reviews.Title: “Super Location with perfect service”
Reviews.Author: Stasnyc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for 5 night Perfect service, great concierge. Room is not to big, but feels great, because of wonderful window. Special thank you to Elaine Chiu, who make our stay perfect. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful rooms, inconsistent service”
Reviews.Author: Marc91C
Reviews.Content: For those who want a conveniently located hotel, Hyatt Regency Hong Kong Tsim Sha Tsui is the hotel to choose. For those of you taking the Airport Express Line, make a stop at Kowloon Station. There is a complimentary airport express shuttle bus (service K3) that runs every 10-12 minutes and it takes you directly to Hyatt Regency Tsim Sha Tsui (2nd stop). Do note that service K3 runs using a mini-bus, and it can get really packed, so do join the queue early so that you would have space to secure your luggage. The driver is a hell-rider so you have to be alert otherwise you might miss your stop or you might be hit by luggage that come flying off the rack. For those of you who wish to get a cab straight down, if the taxi driver is not familiar with the place, the entrance to the underground hotel porch/lobby is along Mody Road. The hotel is also easily via MTR specifically Tsim Sha Tsui and East Tsim Sha Tsui Stations. From the mall, you may choose to exit from Carnarvon Road, Hanoi Road or Mody Road. There are road-level MTR access points to either station (they’re connected underground) at the roads named above. I only found a lift along the access point on Hanoi Road. The other access points only have stairs. For the moderately mobile, I suggest going down to Basement 2 of K11 to find MTR Exit N4 (near misocool restaurant) instead. The lifts are somewhat complicated. The lifts that run within the mall is separate from the lifts that run within the hotel lobby and porch, and the latter itself is separate from the lifts which take you up to your rooms. You will understand when you get there, but I believe this is done for security of the hotel guests. The porters/bellboys are really friendly and constantly insist on handling your luggage for you. Tipping is optional here. There was a slight problem during check-in. I booked 3 rooms for my family of seven, and 2 of us were placed on a different floor. When we requested that our 3 rooms be placed on the same floor, the receptionist gladly obliged. He was very polite and courteous, and even arranged for two of the rooms to be connecting ones, for which I’m really grateful. It made a really good first impression on the hotel and its staff. Even along the way up to our rooms, housekeeping staff would pause and greet us with warm smiles. It was as if they were telling us that, “Rest assured, here at Hyatt Regency, you would be well taken care of.” Their service was put to the test over 5 days, and I must say that apart from several loopholes, the service was generally impressive. One of the toilets had a drainage issue which caused flooding when the toilet was flushed. Thankfully the whole incident was efficiently rectified with the prompt arrival of plumbers and housekeeping staff within minutes of calling guest services. Other instances include prompt delivery of an extra pillow when requested for. Then there are the discrepancies in service; for example, housekeepers give you new bedroom slippers each day but fail to replenish the coffee and tea. On my last night, they slipped a letter under our door containing a booking confirmation for airport transfer services (with additional charges) which we did not make. When we called up guest services to clarify the matter, the staff assured that they would check and get back to us but failed to do so. It was only after we approached hotel reception the next morning that the staff got round to checking. We were told that this was a mistake on their part. To err is human; such mistakes are understandable, but I just did not like the way they handled it. If we had not pursued it, we could have ended up paying unnecessarily for services we did not even request for. This really put a dent in the wonderful first impressions I got from this hotel. The interior of the hotel rooms have a simple yet nice modern touch to it. You can sit on the leather sofa by the length of the window to admire lovely scenic views depending on which direction your room is facing. I was lucky enough to get the room facing the Hong Kong Island side. It was really beautiful! No complains from me with regards to the room design, though I think this hotel would appeal more to travellers on business rather than families. Maybe it’s just me, but the desk at the corner of the room really gives the room an “office” vibe. The beds are very comfortable, the sheets are really soft; you would have no trouble sleeping at all. The mattress of the rollaway bed however, was thinner. When you sleep, you can feel the frame of the bed underneath. Pillows in this hotel are really thin and soft, so do request for an extra if you’ve got a rollaway bed; they come with only one pillow, and it’s very uncomfortable to sleep on. To be honest, the most fascinating part of the room is the toilet. Even the tap is designed to let water flow like a mini fountain! The toilet is really huge for Hong Kong standards! There is a standing shower accompanied by a bathtub. Even in the standing shower room itself, you can choose the conventional shower, or the overhead rain shower! The cupboard can be accessed from 2 ways, from the outside, or from inside the toilet as well. That way, you don’t have to find places to put your clothing, all you need is to open the cupboard and grab what you need! The toilet has speakers too, so when you switch on the television, you can hear what’s happening on television from inside the toilet. Pretty interesting stuff! All in all, my stay at this hotel was really enjoyable. I would’ve like complimentary Wi-Fi though! Even though there were areas where there were shortfalls in service, I feel that as a whole, this hotel has some pretty high standards befitting of a 4½ star-rating hotel. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Confortable rooms, efficient service”
Reviews.Author: AllanMCCosta
Reviews.Content: Everything you would expect from a Hyatt. Good location, efficient service and very confortable rooms. Excellent value and tasteful breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: silvermasked
Reviews.Content: first visit was fantastic, great service, attention to detail, super clubroom, view to die for. second visit we didnt think it would get any better but it did with an upgrade to a room that i could only imagine alexis carrington would use when she would fly over to sign the deeds for the south china sea rigs. i suggest you dont eat for a few days and then go make a reservation for their buffet. i am a big fan of a buffet especially one that has 5 different chef stations with 5 different themes. Im going back to stay again next visit

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, usually very good service except once”
Reviews.Author: MuneerH
Reviews.Content: I am a regular at this hotel and love to stay mainly because of its location. The rooms a very nice and service and food is also good. I had one bad experience with the service but won't get into it since it was just once out of many great stays. I am here mainly for business and would recommend it to any business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value , Best Service”
Reviews.Author: SyedNoorMShah
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Regency took me by surprise. Hong Kong is a expensive place to live in . I came to hong Kong with my family on a visit and choose Hyatt regency since it had good reviews and the price for the rooms is a steal compared to the other hotels. I found the hotel to be great. Great spacious rooms , Very Very co operative staff. They didnt say No to me . What you ask they try there best to help you out. I discussed my travelling inquiries with them etc and there discussed with a smile. The room service was top notch . Within 2 mins there was somone at the door. my wife ordered breakfast in room early in the morning and it was done in a grand fashion. I am totally satisfied with the hotel. If you are coming to hong kong for Shopping then i guess the best place to do so is Canton Road and its near this hotel. 5 mins by cab i guess. 10 by walk. Just visit Harbour Mall and there is everything u need. I just have 2 minor things that i hold against this hotel: 1. There are 2 lifts u have to take if you want to go out from your room. One takes you to the lobby and the other takes you outside. 2. I applied for Dubai visas while i was there. My visas were mailed to the hotel in a urgently manner. When i inquired at the concierge then there was this guy (chinese like). I told him that i am looking for my visas , are they with you. Without thinking he said No they arent here Sir. I was not sure how can he say No so fast. I asked him to check the hotels mail maybe they are there. As a courtesy or to satisfy me he Should have checked again in front of me to satisfy me but he again said in a Flash Sir i have checked the system there arent no Visas. That was where i felt like i was getting Trash Service. Moreover he said if we get them you will be noticed in your room asap. I left the hotel came at night. I went directly to the conceirge and asked him are there any visas, He said Yes we got them and i was about to send them to your room. I felt like he got it earlier and didnt even bothered to send them until i am asking for them in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “As Expected from a New Hyatt Regency”
Reviews.Author: StuckinBangers
Reviews.Content: Great location, right amongst the bustle of TST, this hotel was able to deliver all expected of the Hyatt mid tier product. Quite new, and well maintained the rooms are a good size for TST with oversized bathrooms. Friendly staff, in a typical robotic Hong Kong sort of way, we stayed at a club harbour view room. Breakfast in the club was good, the views amazing as you would expect (especially at night), the pool is a little less resort style than expected as it is shared by the apartments which occupy the second half of the high rise building. I think a well priced, solid hotel and a good option in TST.

Reviews.Title: “A great location to explore Tsim Sha Tsui”
Reviews.Author: fearsomepuppy
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt TST is connected to both the K11 Mall and the connected metro underground walkways giving it an enviable location and easy accessibility to explore TST whatever the weather is like outside. The hotel is new, being a couple of years old with rooms which are pretty well designed and relatively sizeable by Hong Kong standards. Highlights are a great bar and Hugo's the restaurant which has been rejuvenated from the previous Hyatt in TST which is now a mall called iSquare. In addition, staff are both welcoming and efficient a true sign of a well run hotel. The gym is accessible 24hrs and decently equipped (though no view to shout home about) and there is an outdoor pool, though as this is shared with the residences which are also part of the complex, I would term it is basic rather than luxurious. In summary, fantastic location and would recommend it especially if you're looking to visit for some retail therapy in the centre of TST, Kowloon

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hyatt in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: DiamondGP80
Reviews.Content: I have stayed multiple times at all 3 Hyatts in Hong Kong, and by far the Hyatt Regency Tsim Sha Tsui is my favorite among the 3. While it may not be as grand or opulent as the Grand Hyatt, this hotel ticks all the right boxes for me. First, I really love the location. It is smack bang in the middle of the hustle and bustle of TST. There is a free shuttle bus from the Airport Express station and there are numerous entrances to the MTR (subway) around the hotel, one of which is in the basement of the small shopping mall connected directly to the hotel. From these entrances, it is about a 5-min walk to both East TST and TST stations via moving walkways. Taxis are also plentiful. Being right in the heart of TST is great for shopping and the hotel is within walking distance too to the Avenue of the Stars for the nightly Symphony of Lights and also about a 10-min walk to the Star Ferry. Second, they really treat me very well here. Being a Hyatt Diamond member, I am always upgraded to a Harbour view room on a high floor with access to the Regency Club, even when I am staying for free on points. The room itself is somewhat small, but it is clean and modern, which I really like. The harbour view from the room is jaw-dropping no matter how many times I've been to Hong Kong. Third, the staff here is first rate, especially the staff at the Regency Club. The Club itself is also very nice, somewhat small but never gets very full, and I really like the design and interior and again, the harbor view. The food selection in the evenings and for breakfast is very limited but adequate. The service from the staff, while less polished compared to their colleagues at the Grand Hyatt, is still excellent and comes across as genuinely warm and friendly. The service does suffer during busier times at breakfast, where it is sometimes difficult to get the table cleared or to get another cup of coffee, etc., but it is by no means the staff's fault. The problem is they only have about 1-2 staff at any one time during service hours, but I can see that the staff does work really hard so I don't mind a bit of waiting. Overall, this is an excellent hotel. It exceeds my expectations on every stay and I will continue to make it my number 1 choice when I come to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Back to the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: montrealer1110
Reviews.Content: After having spent the last few visits at the Icon, I decided to try the Hyatt again because the Icon's rates were now as high as any other hotel and the location is not very good. This last visit to the Hyatt was much more positive then my last visit. My biggest problem with the Hyatt before was the lack of service, but this has changed tremendously. My only beef is the high cost of internet access. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Truly enjoyed our stay at the HR TST!”
Reviews.Author: snod73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here almost a week. We miss the great people at this Hyatt!! We had the harbor view rooms for both our stays here (we paid for it). The view is simply superb! (The Canon building will be in your view from the room, no matter what). Rooms were modern, clean and well maintained. Housekeeping was simply excellent. Anything we needed was delivered in 2-5 minutes. We had breakfast here every day. The breakfast has an extensive spread. However, we found it somewhat lacking in certain vegetarian options. This issue was overcome with the help of the cafe manager Benny Lee who made sure we got delicious food every day!! A tip = lunch and dinner buffet have an even broader spread with Indian food added in the spread. The Indian chef was awesome! Front desk staff were fine. Jade was most helpful. We felt the location of the hotel was ok. If it is summer, we suggest you walk underground (subway entry opposite the hotel door on the ground level). Walking on the roads have a couple of issues....too many people trying to hawk something to you. We also found a couple of the side roads to be shady. THere was one particular 7-11 which always had "suspicious" characters in front of it...(think of the flesh trade). We quickly learned to avoid these spots. Highly recommend the Hyatt Regency at Tsim Tsa Tsui! We cannot wait to get back here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to be when in Hongkong”
Reviews.Author: ANANDBHANSALI
Reviews.Content: I had gone there for our summer holidays with my family including kids from 23rd May 2012 and have stayed there for 3nts.We had a great time at the hotel. We being of Indian ethnicity, food is always a problem when traveling abroad especially with kids as we are strict vegetarians.But hats off to the Excecutive Chef he was so courteous that looking at our problem during the breakfast he ordered one of his chef who was also an Indian to prepare vegetarian food of our choice..Wat more could we ask for. Also the rooms were spacious (unlike other hotels of hongkong)...Overall a very good experience.Staff as also polite and courteous and were extending themselves to serve us in the best possible way Everything was nearby whether shopping, Indian dining, MTR..We felt that we are roaming in our own country.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, okay location”
Reviews.Author: DingHo K
Reviews.Content: This was our 10th visit to Hong Kong and this is by far the best hotel that we have stayed at. The hotel is very modern and almost feels like a W hotel. The rooms had the standard twin double beds and a long bench in front of the window. We had 2 different rooms during our stay (we left for Macau for 2 days) and the first room had a view over the pools and the 2nd had views of Victoria Harbor. The bathroom was perfect for families. There is an large shower open on one side facing the tub. The kids could splash around in the tub without getting the floor wet and then get dried off in the shower area after their bath. The double mirrors over the sink was actually a sliding door that could open up to the room. You could watch the kids in the room or watch tv while brushing your teeth. There was also a door in the bathroom that accessed the closet so that you didn't have to bring any clothes into the bathroom, just have it ready in the closet. They also offered all the amenities (toothbrush, razor, cotton swabs, comb etc.) and the housekeeping services were excellent. We had the breakfast buffet included in our package, which included meals for 2 adults and 2 kids. They had an excellent selection of fruit juices - watermelon, honeydew, grapefruit, and orange. There was 2 types of congee available with all the usual topping and the fried dough sticks. There was also a noodle soup station. There was dim sum and other chinese food available but these were not their best dishes. I like the pancake and Belgium waffles that were made to order next to the egg station, which made fried eggs, scrambled, or omelets to order. There was also ham, bacon, canadian bacon, and a smoked salmon. The breakfast pastries were also good - I liked the pain au chocolat. My husband used the gym facilities and thought it was very updated and well equipped. We did not have time to try out the pools, though we did see other guests swimming from our room. The location is the only thing that could be improved at the wonderful hotel. The hotel is actually located in East Tsim Sha Tsui. Even though you can access the MTR area quickly, either across the street from the hotel where there is an elevator (we had a stroller) or through the K11 mall, the actual entrance to the MTR area is at least a 7-10minute walk (there are 2 people movers and an open area before you get the the station's G exit). The hotel is located in between 2 MTR lines. So while it is nice that you can walk underground to get to many different areas, it's A LOT of walking underground. Above ground gets a little confusing and around the hotel are a bunch of small side streets which were a little scary if you weren't sure you were walking the right way to the hotel. Luckily I was with my parents who are Hong Kong natives. Also the since the hotel is new, it would be handy to keep the hotel's business card/map that you are given at check in to show to taxi drivers since the hotel's main taxi entrance is underground and there isn't a direct street drop off area or you can tell them it's a the K-11 mall. We didn't really shop or eat at the K-11 mall, but there is a Jason's marketplace on the 2nd floor (?) so that you can buy drinks, snacks, candy, etc. Across the street from the K-11 mall is the Tsui Wah restaurant, a well known Hong Kong style cafe with reasonable prices and large corner tables if you have a group. i would recommended staying here just because the hotel is so nice and new and the breakfast buffet is delicious. However, traveling with little kids and anyone who has some difficulty walking, the location is just too far from the MTR entrance.

Reviews.Title: “A true 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luxury_traveller504
Reviews.Content: The hotel reception, restaurants, rooms and other common areas are modern and well designed. It's an international, modern style with an Asian touch. The rooms are quite big and the double rooms are spacy enough for two people. The room had all the amenities I expect from this kind of hotel and then some. Nice and spacy bathroom with both bath tub and shower. I'm a Hyatt Diamond member so had access to the Club lounge. It's nice and relaxed and with a view over the harbour and the city. The selections for breakfast is somewhat limited in the club. The staff is professional. They are so professional that it feels a bit arrogant. They do their jobs well, but it is strained. It is as if they have been thought how to smile and talk politely and would not have done it otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Not much better than this”
Reviews.Author: adamvenga
Reviews.Content: This place was phenomenal!! Absolutely beautiful, not to mention spacious for rooms for the location. Was lucky enough to have a fantastic view over Kowloon. Everything was pristine. The only problem is, now I compare everything to this hotel. Breakfast was a very nice buffet style.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Michele B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good Hyatt Quality,with great room and wonderful staff. There is a lovely rooftop pool which was great for lounging as well as swimming. We had breakfasts( including wonderful Chinese set meal) and one dinner at Cafe. Food and service were excellent. Metro accessed under hotel, ten minute walks to either Star Ferry, various museums, promonade with nightly light show or to a bus to Stanley, Repulse Bay, etc. The immediate neighborhod was touristy and not very attractive, convenient,but not lovely. However, a good home base.

Reviews.Title: “Nice City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: elguwapo316
Reviews.Content: ...Hyatt TST, is conveniently located near Nathan Rd. The place is close to a lot of tourist shops, apparel stores, restaurants etc. The Hotel sits on top of K11 mall. The lobby and hallway was a little dark (but I got used to it after a while). The MTR Tsim Sha Tsui Station is located right outside the hotel - making the hotel very accessible. Overall, Hyatt TST is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Stunning View's (From High Floor Rooms)”
Reviews.Author: thedukeof82
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay in Hong Kong; which was both sad and difficult to leave!! Our hotel was located on the Kowloon Side of Hong Kong; overlooking Victoria Peak, the Harbor & of Hong Kong Island. We upgraded to a Harbor View; which was WELL worth it! There was a great little window seat; that I stayed up each night on, and watched the city for 30 minutes or more. Keep in mind that the fire alarms are very sensitive!! I left the Bathroom Door open while taking a shower; and the steam from the shower set off not only our room fire alarm; but all of the remaining fire alarms on our Hotel Floor. Concierge is VERY helpful; and Room Service is at your every desire! You're a couple blocks from the Pier and step's from all the shopping!!!! Very happy we stayed at this Hotel.......

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: Ange2404
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon and everything about the hotel was amazing! From the moment we arrived we were treated so nicely. They offered to take our bags and we were led up to the Regency lounge check in. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived but the ladies at the lounge were so lovely and allowed us to have breakfast there while we waited for our room. When we got to our room, it was so chic and modern. I loved the bathroom! Very clean and spacious, great TV and bed. The Regency Lounge was superb in every way. The food offered at breakfast and before dinner was delicious - just the right mix of Chinese and Western foods. The ladies that took care of the Regency lounge were so lovely and helpful - amazing service. We were so lucky to have access at the lounge because it had the most spectacular views of the harbour. There was even a fireworks display during our stay and we had an awesome view! Central location - the hotel was basically attached to a shopping centre so you could just go downstairs to go shopping. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Regency.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME !!!!”
Reviews.Author: AussieExplorerSale
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay the best hotel by far i stayed in on this trip. Location, great Staff, great food great room, great etc......... Little japanese resturant across the street from main entrance awesome food.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, would come back, but could use some improvents”
Reviews.Author: Jeff L
Reviews.Content: Jet lag on our first night has allowed me a plethora of time to write this review on my iPad (Internet 350 HK for 3 days). Checked in at 9am, bell hop unloaded our luggage and tagged them with a smile. Upstairs, check in was smooth, answered all my questions and ended every sentence with "hai", I guess they are well trained for their Japanese visitors. Came back in an hour and our rooms were ready. The room is modern looking. The bathroom has a couple interesting sliding doors that open into the main room and the closet. Did find a dry blood stain on a pillow case and a hair ball in the shower. Both items were taken care of immediately. The room is spacious for Hong Kong standards. There are no drawers to put yours clothes in. They offer a transformer to allow your 110 volt items to work. The first one was defective. Great location and the service is excellent, would definitely come back and recommend to friends. We will see if the buffet is as great was everyone claims. We still have two more nights here, hope my review does not change.

Reviews.Title: “Book Early for Advanced Rate”
Reviews.Author: Ron S
Reviews.Content: My wife, 1 year old and myself are spending 3 nights at Hyatt TST and we are quite impressive and satisfied with this hotel. I asked for the following well in advance since we were arriving in HK late in the evening and didn't want to have to get a "leftover" room with our baby probably being tired after a 14 hour flight. - HIgher level - above 15F to avoid any road level noise - Corner room - as I heard these are larger and potentially have harbour views - Baby crib - Late Check-in Upon arrival, the bell service was excellent as they brought our bags to our hotel room a few minutes upon entering the room, and we had a few heavy ones.The crib was already set up which was awesome... The room was a King bed room and it was pretty large for a HK hotel - small for a North American hotel. This is a new hotel so everything looked pretty good, but the carpets in from of the Lobby elevators are already showing a lot of wear. Good lobby and efficient services... The room was what we asked for - on 20th floor, in a corner and the view was good. THe bed was large as advertised (king) and the room temperature control was great (actually changes upon touch which is very decent). Other things were nice, new and standard. Love the washroom as it had a lot of glass and open space to the room. Things to watch out for as a guest - Internet is not free - $80HK (1 hr), $150HK (24 hrs), $350HK (3 days) - this standard should be free nowadays! - Make sure the taxi driver knows how to get into the hotel (ours was great and knew exactly where to go as we needed the bell service for our bags) - about $250HK from the airport - Bottle water was provided free of charge (2 bottles) and have to ask for refills or wait for room service next day - The lobby is 3 levels above the street so you have to take an elevator to the street every time. - There are a few bars across the street so it's probably quite noisy if your room is facing that direction and low. Overall, this is a very good Hyatt (as some Hyatts I have been to are getting stale and old looking). This one incorporates a very good blend of Chinese art and western decor. We will not be trying any of the restaurants here since there are sooooooo many others in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: gayler104
Reviews.Content: This hotel met all of our expectations except one. Sometimes after a day of sightseeing and finally arriving back to our hotel we like to "chill out" in the lobby & people watch before going up to our room. There are no chairs in the lobby only benches. I suppose that is the management's choice to keep the lobby free of people. With that in mind, that would not prevent us from revisiting this property. The buffet breakfast is plentiful, the guest rooms are modern & spacious. We were very happy with the location too.

Reviews.Title: “Probably better than the Grand...”
Reviews.Author: ACF2010
Reviews.Content: Probably Hyatt's best hotel in HK. Was my first stay but stayed at the Grand in Wan Chai before and this felt better. Room spacious and modern with good quality furniture and fittings, extensive outdoor pool area (biggest outdoor pool is TST I reckon...) and Hugo's restaurant had fantastic service even though I found the set-lunch a little uninspiring. One more thing worth mentioning is that it's quite complicated to get into! The hotel lobby is on 4th floor which means either finding the right entrance or walking through the mall. Nevertheless this is become more common in hotels so need to be used to it but could be better marked.

Reviews.Title: “nice harbour view”
Reviews.Author: ma c
Reviews.Content: the harbour view room is excellent and good location

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Amazing Rooms and Amazing rates”
Reviews.Author: hasonteh1
Reviews.Content: Cheaper in comparison to Grand Hyatt properties but everything i need is already here. I dont have anything to ask for, Fast Internet Access, Replenishment of towels 2 x a day. Provides turn down service. Great breakfast, Great Bed. Location so amazing cross the street and you got mtr station, go to basement and you got taxi to go anywhere in HK and Go to Nathan Road and shop till you drop, Oh My God!!!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: wedmanSingapore
Reviews.Content: This hotel is relatively new and it shows. The hotel is modern and tastfully decorated and is housed above a shopping mall and below residential apartments all in the one tower. I had an executive room with a king bed. I believe this meant that I had both a bath and a shower (separate) and perhaps a few square metres more than a standard room. The bed is firm yet comfortable. The bathroom is spacious and has a nice assortment of toiletries. The room has great block-out curtains to ensure a sleep in and very effective air conditioning. The gym is obvisouly housed in what used to me a couple of rooms. It has a great assortment of new machines and space to do some floor exercises. There is an outdoor heated pool with a wonderful deck area. I ate dinner in Hugo's Restuarant (which was exceptional) had a drink in the bar (Chin Chin's) which has an excellent ambience and live band later at night and had breakfast which offered a nice buffet and eggs cooked to order. Above all the service was terrific. For example, when I went doen for dinner I was advised that the group I was meeting had gone down to the bar for a pre-dinner drink. Rather than point me in the direction, the staff member walked to to the elevator ans escorted me all the way to the entrance of the bar. I will definitely stay here for my next trip to HK.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Hyatt I've stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Joyous91
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency in Hong Kong was wonderful. Everything is five stars- location is close to the train and walking distance to Ave of the Stars. Services was impeccable and kind. The room was beautiful- modern, large, quiet, calm. I particularly enjoyed sitting on the window seat each morning, drinking coffee and looking out over the city. It is an oasis. No complaints, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “My Stay at Hyatt Regency Hong Kong Tsim Sha Tsui”
Reviews.Author: Happy H
Reviews.Content: Our Stay at the Hyatt Regency Tsim Sha Tsui was excellent. We had room service from the Hyatt and most cost HK$75 and was just super fantastic. We had waffles to Dim Sum Combination to pancakes. If you have a Hyatt Gold Passport, you have a free cup of coffee or tea served with milk etc. The food at the Chinese Restaurant was good, we had lobster, abalones, it was just too good. However you must pay for the internet. Service was good, it was convenient as it was situated next to the Tsim Sha Tsui and East Tsim Sha Tsui for easy access. It was great.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: IntlTrainer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on two separate occasions in one week during my visit to Hong Kong. The first was for a seminar my company sponsored for a group of international customers and the second was one night I stayed after coming back from Macau. Here are my thoughts: Good: - Check in was easy - Quiet room (I had one on each side of hotel) -Clean -Bed comfortable - Internet worked -Buffet in the Cafe was good for all meals -Staff tried to work hard -Central Kowloon location in walking distance to the ferry to Hong Kong island Not so good: -No view, only other buildings -There is a separate internet cost for each device. Why is it that the cheaper the hotel, the more services are for FREE and the more expensive, the more they want to nickel and dime for everything??? -Buffet was the SAME every day - nothing new. You would think that they would change things up but no. -There were several people at the front desk who were eternally slow - I happened not to get them. I would stay here again when I go back to Hong Kong; however, I think I may want to check out another hotel to find a view...

Reviews.Title: “Great for business events, prime location..”
Reviews.Author: Otic
Reviews.Content: Our company recently held a seminar for our asia distributors in Hyatt Regency TST. Seldom have I experienced such a service level; management and staff did their utmost to make our event a success. Having 25 years experience I know how to appreciate. Besides, rooms are clean and well equipped. In our package Internet was included; it worked very well. Our guests were happy and very satisfied. Breakfast is very good, nice choice, excellent coffee and fresh juices. We had several buffet lunches in the cafe.Selection is rich and the buffet highly recommendable. The location is great, close to MRT and shopping, walking distance to the ferries.

Reviews.Title: “Five star service at a three star price.”
Reviews.Author: MM9U
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong has many famous hotels, many of which seem to be trading on reputation rather than service. I recognize that we're not the ideal customer: one adult and one child coming off a long plane ride, but every contact with staff showed that they genuinely wanted to provide the best possible service. On check-in, we were offered an upgrade to a larger room, which we declined due to a preference for twin beds. We stayed in the smallest of the club floor rooms, twin beds, a usable desk (finally, a hotel that gets working in the room!), a comfortable chair, and a bathroom almost as large as the room: rain shower, soaking tub, and enough towels for a twelve year old. The lounge was adequate for breakfast, (missing only my favorite pineapple juice,) and was welcoming on every visit. I recognize that many travelers don't want children in the lounge, but I travel with one, so a lounge that actually welcomes them is important to me. To note, the lounge has two large rooms, and on every visit the families with children seemed to have self-selected the front room, leaving the back room a quiet place to enjoy a paper and a cup of coffee. A most unusual comment, coming from me: the hotel buffet (The Cafe) was easily the best meal we had on this trip: quick friendly service (amazing since we walked in late, with an obviously cranky twelve year old), fresh cooked food (no steam table pasta!), excellent fish, in a room laid out well enough that though full, there was no crowding and no rush. Since I am known for my hate of hotel restaurants, this is the highest praise I can give.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: heiress29
Reviews.Content: Everything was excellent...the room accomodation was modern and clean (we got the deluxe room which has a bathtub). The staff were very friendly and speaks good english. Check-in and check-out was fast. The breakfast buffet has a lot of variety and was very good. The hotel location was perfect. Within shopping district in TST. The hotel is above the K11 mall. Convenience to MTR...there's one across the ground entrance and MTR exit in the K11 mall. The only thing that bothers me is the internet connection is not free. But overall, i would still recommend the hotel and would go back if ever me and my family will be in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Spent 3 Weeks at Hyatt TST”
Reviews.Author: MissAmanda2008
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 weeks at the Hyatt TST while travelling for business from North America. Hotel staff was courteous and friendly, although concierge did not speak well enough in English to understand what I was asking for on a couple of occasions. Room service people are nice and polite and staff is helpful with things like bags and arranging transport, etc. Room was spacious for HK, and extremely great location- only a short MTR trip from Central or 2 minute walk to Nathan Road. It's attached to a cute little boutique mall called the K11 which had all kinds of cute stores in it and a delicious frozen yogurt store called Smile. Great view of the harbor and lots of storage in room. My favorite part by far was the rain shower head in the bathroom which was superb. The only downfall I had with the hotel is that the Wireless internet (which you have to pay for, and is quite expensive) was no good. On multiple occasions, I couldn't get a wifi signal in my room and had to plug in through wired connection to the desk. Not a big deal, but when you're paying alot for wireless internet access, this irritated me. Longest package you could buy was for 3 days, which didn't help a long-term traveller like me. Overall, great hotel and would recommend to anyone travelling for business or pleasure- solo or with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JayRae
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent Christmas in Hong Kong. This hotel is in a great shopping district with easy access to the easy-to-use Hong Kong subway system. It's also an easy walk to the Star Ferry Pier. So it is really ideally located in Kowloon with quick access to Hong Kong island. Our basic room was anything but; spacious with a comfortable bed and large bathroom and an nice view of the city even from just the 10th floor. Breakfast was included and the buffet had great food and selection. Nice pool out on a terrace with a great view of the skyline. Other than breakfast the restaurants are too expensive, even for Hong Kong (which is not cheap). But the adjoining mall and nearby neighborhood had lots of good local choices. Very good value for the money in an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Monique050
Reviews.Content: Three girlfriends and I came to Hong Kong for a week of shopping and eating. We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Tsim Sha Tsui. The rooms were fabulous with an amazing view of Hong Kong harbour. The staff were extremely helpful . We had breakfast and happy hour in the regency Club and the food was excellent. Under the hotel there's a small but very good shopping mall that connected to the subway system. We were there in july and it was very hot. You could walk through the clean and bright subway tunnels all the way to the ferry area and Harbour City. I would definitely stay here again. It couldn't have got any better!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, hotel, and service”
Reviews.Author: BB88888
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on business in early Jan 2012. From check-in to check-out, the stay was fantastic. Rooms are spacious for HK, location is great - right in the middle of Kowloon, and close enough to the MTR to make getting around HK very easy, and the service is exceptional. In room dining is a little overpriced but the quality is high. Overall a great stay and will certainly return. Highly recommended for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Book with confidence”
Reviews.Author: odmea
Reviews.Content: This property is amazing from rooms, amenties, service, staff, professional and curteous. Stay here - wonderful kowloon location very close to water. A beautiful stroll (20 mins) to Ferries to Hong Kong Island and Macau. This walk is entirely along Hong Kong Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: vittoParis
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent choice if you decide to stay in Kowloon. Of course HK island is more elegant and pleasant for people on holiday . If you stay in Kowloon, it is probably for business. Then the Hyatt is centrally located, close to the MTR, within walking distance from the Ferry..... Large room, huge bathroom with shower and tub...flat screen LCD..... Very clean, except that the Wi Fi is being charged 150HKD ! The hotel is linked to a small shopping mall K11, where you can find some restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: InTheMomentManhattan
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency is a very nicely appointed new hotel on the Kowloon side of Hong Kong. It has a great location in the center of Tsim Sha Tsui, the most exciting area of Kowloon. My room was not particularly large but it was very nicely designed with high quality finishes. But it is really yhe location that makes the hotel special. The MTR [subway] is just a few steps away. The same for Nathan Road, probably the most major shopping street in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - but missing some 5 star amenities”
Reviews.Author: jetblue09
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Hyatt Regency for 2 nights right before the new year. The hotel has a phenomenal location right in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui. The East Tsim Sha Tsui MTR Station (Exit N2) is right outside the hotel, which also acts as an underground walkway that leads to the waterfront. The lobby is located a few floors up. Taxis can either drop you off in the basement of the hotel where bellmen are present, or the side entrance, which is more low key. The hotel is extremely modern. One holds up the key card to the door in order to access the room as well as the elevator as opposed to the old swipe method. We reserved two standard rooms instead of a harbor view, but the city view rooms still have a partial view of the harbor. The rooms are really spacious and have a typical clean modern Hyatt design. The bathroom has a rainforest shower and a unique sink design. The breakfast and lunch buffets were very elaborate and could cater to anyone’s taste with Chinese, Indian, Japanese, and American options. There was also a large outdoor pool and hot tub. There were two aspects of this hotel that really bugged me: 1. There was no free Internet in the rooms. In addition, there was no business center with computers. We stayed at the Langham Place last year, which at least had a business center with computers. Luckily, I discovered that the K11 Mall in the basement of the hotel has free wifi, so we went down there to get Internet access. 2. In addition, I found the gym to be really tiny! Free weights only went up to 14kg (30 pounds) and there were no strength machines. Not that this was a deal breaker, but coming from the Marco Polo in Shenzhen and Shangri-La in Guilin, there was no comparison. Overall, we had a nice stay at the Hyatt Regency. The location was great for us and the hotel provided a good value for Hong Kong. However, if we were to come back to Hong Kong again, we will try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Another fine Hyatt in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: knowmyhotels
Reviews.Content: I spent a night at this Hyatt on the last day of my trip after several days at the Grand Hyatt. The hotel is very modern and chic - call it the younger version of Grand Hyatt. Decor is not as stately as Grand Hyatt but still very elegant. The view is not as awsome as Grand Hyatt across the harbor but still quite nice. Location-wise, this is as good as it gets. It's near the MTR station and near HK's top shopping district, easy to get to and from, from just about everywhere... I had a unfortunate taxi experience on a different trip, so I opted for a taxi ride to the MTR station in the morning, to catch the airport express to HKG. It was super convenient but taxi driver was probably not too happy because of the small fare to the station :) Room is well appointed but the bathroom is a bit too chic for me that they prioritized looks over practicality but it met my expectation for the price point. Bath amenity is the standard spread for Hyatts in Asia, definitely not the spa ones provided at Grand Hyatt. The gym is quite expansive for one in a hotel, it served me, a bit of a gym rat, quite well, so thumbs up for that. Regency Club is modern and delightful. Food spread has a good variety and is quite tastey though seems to be in short supply. There were a lot of guests using the Regency Club, so it's understandable that things may run out. They kept the wine bottles full at all times, so that made the occasional wait not so bad ;) Overall, a great stay for a Regency class Hyatt. I would definitely come back because of one factor - it's location and convenience to MTR.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and view on HK Island”
Reviews.Author: MademoiselleAmandine
Reviews.Content: We really enjoy our stay in this Hotel Location : Perfect in Kowloon. Less than 1 minute to the subway. 15minutes by walking from Stars Avenue and Star Ferry. Room : our room had an amazing view on HK Island and IFC Mall. The only inconvenience was they give us a smoking room without asking us at the beginning ! But is was ok the smell wasn't too strong Breakfast : A little bit poor for the continental side, but perfect for the asian side ! Tastefull, warm, nice dim sum. A lot of choice for bread. You also can enjoy cheese ! The coffee was really good like in the Italian coffee. Service : always smiling and someone for opening you the door

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for business and leisure”
Reviews.Author: Thomas831
Reviews.Content: Overall Excellent, modern, very clean hotel at a very convenient location. The hotel is more the business hotel type, but with the large pool also excellent for the holiday traveller. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Overall, we spent nine nights in three different rooms and were absolutely satisfied. The hotel occupies the lower third (up to level 24) of the K11 building in Kowloon. Subway is directly opposite the hotel entrance. In detail: Rooms All the room’s interiors are new, modern and the rooms are very clean. The Deluxe Rooms have a larger bathroom with tub and separate shower, the standard rooms only have a shower, though very nice, see below. Our comments refer to room numbers 1418 (King Room), 1812 (Harbour View King) and 2310 (Club Harbour King). Room numbers xx08 to xx23 (see floor plan picture) are facing the harbour, some, as room xx18 have a little restricted view due to the adjacent room xx17 that is sticking out. Numbering is the same on all floors. On floors 23 and 24 the Regency Club occupies the space of rooms xx12 to xx20. The rooms are not huge (as often in Hong Kong), but practically equipped with a table and side board that is not stuffed with hotel directories and other things so that you find plenty of space to put your own books, mobiles, laptop or whatever. The cabinets and storing space is a little small for two people staying, but ok for business travellers or short time stays. See Hyatt website for room pictures. It is similar in all rooms. The windows are almost full front with a seating in front so that you can perfectly sit on the window and watch the skyline. Pictures were taken from room 1812. Room 1418 wasn’t too much different, also nice view on the skyline but not titled a harbour view room. Yes, the higher you are, the view gets even better, but I think it doesn’t make to much difference. From rooms xx12 to xx20 you have the view on the Hong Kong Island skyline anyway, from the higher rooms you see just a little more of the harbour. The building (see picture with Harbour view) with the Canon sign will always hide part of the view. And yes, windows are a little dirty from the outside as reported earlier, but it depends more on whether conditions, if you have a nice or foggy view. What else: Beds are great (it’s a Hyatt). Complimentary mineral water in your room (again, it’s a Hyatt). Room is cleaned twice a day. Club rooms have a Nespresso coffee maker. Bathroom Modern, very nice rain shower. The larger rooms (31 square meter) have a tub, the separate rain shower is a barrier-free walk in. Very convenient: it is large enough that you do not need to close the shower doors so you can easily walk in or out. The smaller rooms (28 square meter) have also a nice rain shower, a little smaller (here you’d like to close the doors) and no bath tub. Plenty of space for your wash bag and stuff. A sliding door can be opened to the room, so you can have a view out the window while having a shower. Overall, a very modern and nice bathroom, new and very clean. Service Service everywhere was excellent. Very friendly and helpful staff at front desk, nice restaurant recommendations from the concierge. Special thanks to Emily, Fion and Chilia, and also all the others at the front desk or Regency Club. The same with the housekeeping, they also do a great job, no complaints at all on the cleanliness of the rooms. Location For us it was perfect, I prefer it to Central. But that depends, on how you are on your way. The Hyatt TST is on Kowloon side near Nathan Road. It occupies the first 24 floors of an 60+ floor apartment building (see arrow on picture taken from Hong Kong Island), directly connected to the K11 mall on the lower floors. Directions: First: Taxi drivers don’t know the address (Hanoi Road), but most know Mody Road, where the car entrance is. A map for taxi drivers is on the hotel’s webpage on the Hyatt website. Ask the driver to go to Mody Road.As soon as he turns from Nathan into Mody, it’s only about 100 meters, then on the left hand side you’ll find the entrance to the K11 parking. Hyatt is listed with other companies on the entrance. Once down the parking lot entrance, the driver will easily find the Hyatt entrance on level B3. Only if you don’t have luggage, following Mody road and then turning left into Hanoi Road might be an alternative, where you find a small street side entrance of the Hyatt. Be aware, there is no large driveway as you might be used to from other hotels of this category. Once you have been there, everything is much easier, than it seems from all the reports you find. For us, the Hyatt TST is at a perfect location, since directly opposite is the entrance to the subway where you get to both lines, either Tsim Sha Tsui station or East Tsim Sha Tsui station. From here it is only two stops to central. When coming from the subway, you just follow the exit N3, and you’ll get to Hanoi road just opposite the Hyatt street level entrance. From the hotel, the star ferry pier is only about 5-10 minutes by feet. Plenty of nice harbour view hotel bars are in walking distance (Sheraton, Interconti, Peninsula). Knutsford Terrace also is only a 5 to 10 minutes walk. The big restaurant and night life area however is in Central around Wyndham and LKF. If you prefer travelling by taxi and need to cross the harbour, then be aware of traffic and take cost for the harbour tunnels into account. Going by subway or star ferry is the better choice – and thus for us the Hyatt TST is at a great location. Facilities The pool is great, especially if you like to do some serious swimming. It’s a 25 meters outside pool, with plenty space around. In addition you find a large jacuzzi. There’s changing rooms and facilities. The pool area is on the 9th floor and belongs to the apartment complex. It can be equally used by hotel guests and residents. You obtain large towels from their front desk. When we were there during the week late afternoons and also on weekends only about 4 to 6 other people were around. There’s life guards, but the pool side is without service of food and beverage. (This would be a nice addition though.) There’s also a nice gym with new equipment, but not very big (occupies the size of an xx07 room). It is without any attendance. Restaurants and Lounges The Regency Club is on 23rd and 24th floor. Great views! Free breakfast for Club guests is between 6.30 and 10.00 (11.00 on weekends) and evening drinks from 5:30pm to 7:30pm. The breakfast is good, but not overwhelming (once you’ve been at a Grand Hyatt Club Lounge, e.g. the GH Macau). At the Regency Club they have a small continental breakfast buffet with fruits, yoghurts, rolls, croissants etc. About two warm dishes are served, one western (e.g. eggs or quiche) and one Chinese. Of course there’s varieties of coffee, tea and juice. With the evening drinks (beer, wine, cocktails) also two or three small warm dishes (e.g. Dim Sum) can be ordered. Everything is complimentary for Club room guests. We haven’t been in the hotel’s restaurants for dinner, just had a club sandwich in the afternoon which was good international standard. Other remarks Internet (wireless) in the rooms is only complimentary for Hyatt Platinum and Diamond members. Price Be aware, anything in Hong Kong is very expensive, especially hotels. So is the Hyatt, but it also provides very good value. Hint: When we were asked at check-out whether we would like to pay with our credit card in HKD or EUR, we decided for HKDs. This turned out to be the right decision, since the exchance rate offered was not very good. When we found the amount on our credit card bill (including exchance and transaction fees of 1,75%) it was still about 3% cheaper than the offered EUR price. Recommandation: Definitely, I’d go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Equally good for business and leisure!”
Reviews.Author: EdmondUK
Reviews.Content: Hyatt TST, in my opinion as a fairly frequent guest (5 stays in the last year, I think...), is a good, solid hotel which offers great value, agreeable rooms and unparalleled convenience, regardless of your purpose of stay in Hong Kong. Here is why: Built on top of K11 Mall, a slightly quirky and arty shopping complex, in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui, you have everything a traveller (or actually any local person) needs at your disposal. Last time I counted, there are five 7-11 (a ubiquitous corner shop) within 5 minutes walk, with the closest being right opposite the hotel, though I tend to rely on the full-sized supermarket in the mall called Market Place by Jasons (HKD 299 for a bottle of Moet, anyone?). Eateries in the mall are forgettable and you're spoilt for choice at street-level (give those restaurants within no English menu a try and just point at the pictures!). Service is efficient and professional, as opposed to personable (check out my review of Shangri-La Kowloon). That said, Amy from the front desk and Fiona, a housekeeper on level 15 always seem to remember me and my surname, which makes a small but significant difference. Facilities wise, there is a decent swimming pool (but I've not used it...) and a very respectable gym. Wifi is free (for frequent guests with elite status of their loyalty programme, otherwise not extortionate either) and reliable. Those of you who are observant enough will have noticed that I 'only' awarded three stars to rooms! It is not that they are wrong and inadequate in any way, but the fact is everything you expect from a hotel of this standard is provided but there is nothing worth writing home about. Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station has many exits and the hotel is next to 3 of them. You can get to Central (business/night life district) within 15 minutes and Mongkok (a slice of authentic Hong Kong!) just as fast. Now, inevitably, I will talk about a few things one must do/eat in Hong Kong that your guidebooks don't tell you to: - Have a massage at Taipan, a no-frill place just round the corner. The reflexology is particularly good. - Make a shirt or ten (like I did!) at Baron Kay's Tailor (www.baronkaytailor.com), or a suit or two if you please, which is literally next door to the hotel (and they will deliver your items to you upon request). Ask for Davis Ng who's most helpful. - If you're after good food and couldn't care less about decor and service, my favourite restaurant in Hong Kong is Sheung Hing Chiuchow Restaurant (尚興潮州菜馆). Order the braised goose with tofu (卤水鹅片)! - If you're after good food and DO care about decor and service, my favourite restaurant in Hong Kong is Tim's Kitchen (http://www.timskitchen.com.hk/).

Reviews.Title: “Very Upscale Hotel in Awesome Hong Kong!”
Reviews.Author: Banshee123
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. We stayed here with a group ~20 people and everyone was super impressed with the quality of hotel, friendliness of the staff and location. Everything was upgraded and super nice with excellent views of downtown Hong Kong. The breakfast was incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Will love to return”
Reviews.Author: cotaiking
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights and had a lovely stay. Hotel has an excellent location and attached to the K11 shopping complex and the MTR. Room was surprisingly large for hong kong standard. Deco is modern and the bathroom is well appointed with the excellent rain shower and bathtub. Service is good and personalized. Staff especially the bell desk and cafe were friendly and able to address us by name every time they saw us, really impressive. Room has no view though, very typical of most hong kong hotels. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, seems new”
Reviews.Author: rockohorse
Reviews.Content: Stayed on points Platinum status Paid to upgrade to a "deluxe" room, special was on so it was an extra $100 per night Free Internet with platinum so no idea the cost Upgraded because we wanted two beds - since we thought we might have a friend come by, we were told a corner room was biggest The twins seem like doubles but maybe smaller but it seems that most of the hotel beds we saw were actually two of these "twins" pushed together, i guess they just changed the mattress so you didn't feel a crease in the middle - alteast the bed frames all looked like that Quite a nice room, standard bed(s), desk, big marble bathroom (soaker tub and shower) and a bit of a view of the harbor if you sit on the window bench and look around the corner. We stayed in a few hotels and this one is the only one where we got a view - though the hyatt is really tall The hotel seems to be up to the 25th floor and then its residences up to 66, there is a mall below so i'm not sure where it starts If you want a view of anything you need to be above the pool level (think that was 9 or 10) otherwise you are in line with the neighbouring buildings There is a pool and hottub - and this hot tub was actually hot (unlike the sheraton), they are very pretty and the place was deserted when we went there (sat afternoon) If you have regency club access you'll get a view, it seemed to be on the 25th floor We took the airport bus back from the hotel to Kowloon where we took the airport train - small note here, you can check in at kowloon station up to 90 mins before your flight - boarding pass and bags Very nice service The hyatt sits on a mall ( like many hotels) but this one has a supermarket as well as shops and restaurants. We saw sushi (a huge platter) for $150 and then it was the end of the day so the slashed it to $100. They did this to everything there so you could probably grab an evening snack, plus it seemed like real sushi and not the safe package supermarket stuff from home. The supermarket had an amazing variety of food - i'd say stuff from most western countries but of course you paid dearly for it. But if you're desperate for coffee or tea or campbells soup or whatever its there. The buffet breakfast was about $230 per person, whether its worth that is up to you, but it was quite a good buffet. I'm still thinking the sheraton was slightly better but it had dimsum, breads, eggs, bacon, japanese fish, pancakes - the typical spread, the hyatt actually looks more impressive - the sheraton looks more like a cafeteria.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pranay N
Reviews.Content: Excellent property with a very central and reachable location. Excellent staff and facilities. The swimming pool on the 9th floor is one of the highlights of the property. Also very good gym and spacious and big rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Expensive Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Becky55711
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very modern and the rooms are comfortable. The bathroom has a great rain shower and nice large tub. The room itself was a nice size for Hong Kong and again furnished very modern. The beds were comfortable and there was a nice flat screen, safe, and chair with ottomon. We did have some confusion when we first arrived in the room as we couldn't operate the lights or air. Finally figured out that you have to insert the room key in a slot on the wall near the door which activates the light switches and air. We ate breakfast in the cafe and both days had the buffet. It is way overpriced at $40 US per person and nothing spectacular. The service was lacking: in getting coffee, refills, etc. It wasn't crowded but appeared we were invisible. We also ate at Hugo's, again the food was overpriced and just ok. The service again was lacking. For what you pay the service should be much more attentive. Would probably not stay here again because of the service in the restaurants even though the rooms themselves are nice.

Reviews.Title: “A decent, efficient hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Tokyo Shirokuma
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong is an overwhelmingly busy, noisy, crowded city, and that's coming from someone who lives in central Tokyo! The Hyatt Regency was definitely an oasis in the city. It's very clean, had an spacious bath area with a lovely separate shower with a sink area with a wall that opened to the bed area. The view in the harbor view room was good, though the windows were dirty on the outside. The pool was decent, but in this season only occupied by serious lap swimmers. It didn't feel heated, though they say it is. Complaints. It's a rather sterile hotel, very functional and cookie-cutter with no character, but that may be exactly what you want. It is a chain hotel, after all. The entrance for the taxis is buried down 3 floors under the building and not welcoming. The room service breakfast menu and food was mediocre, and I ate it both mornings I was there. My rate was expensive at 31,000 yen per night, plus taxes, and that was booked on Agoda.com! Most importantly, the beds were hard.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, big rooms, nice view”
Reviews.Author: MetalPigeon
Reviews.Content: We spent a long week-end in the Hyatt Regency TST and were very impressed. The service in particular was the stand out feature. We had adjoining rooms with views over to Hong Kong Island. The rooms are a very good size, particualrly for HK, and the bathrooms also similarly spacious. Our kids had a great time swimming in the pool and the hot water pool was much enjoyed with it getting a bit cooler in the evening. Breakfast was great with a huge variety of buffet and good coffee. The location of the hotel is very good for Nathan Road and other places such as Kowloon Park. It is right over an MTR station also. The lobby being on the 3rd floor and the road access being at basement 3 are the only downside as it can be hard to get a taxi from there and the need to take extra lifts is a bit annoying. When we were there it was my son's 6th birthday. He mentioned it the staff at breakfast and when we got back from a day of sight-seeing in the afternoon the room bell rang and they had sent up a cake for him. What a great touch and an example of the level of service we received there.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic experience in @ hyatt club”
Reviews.Author: AnnualTraveller33
Reviews.Content: perfect when travelling with kids. clean environment. Also perfect for business traveller conveniently located in teh city centre. staff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Pathfinder889
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about 3 years old. The staff is friendly and the rooms are nice and clean. The location is really good since there are many restaurants everywhere outside the hotel. The swimming pool is fully exposed so it gets windy.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: IamWhoIam_SG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hyatt Regency (Tsim Sha Tsui) when we were in Hong Kong for a family vacation. The location was convenient as the hotel is right next to a MTR station. The service was also good. However, the spread of food for breakfast isn't great.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trip8705
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite new and has all the luxury you can imagine. Superbe breakfast. Minus: no free internet / wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves six stars”
Reviews.Author: Thierehh
Reviews.Content: Great location, the staff were excellent and very helpful. We ate there during our short stay and the food was excellent, service was remarkable and prices were right. Overall this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: chrysanthem23
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nites at the Hyatt TST. Room was impeccable - very spacious and clean. Great location. All around great service with one exception. It was quite obvious that there were 2 levels of service provided by the staff at the Cafe (for breakfast), one to Asians and another to non-Asian patrons.

Reviews.Title: “A very good downtown hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Edward-A A
Reviews.Content: I stay here for a weekend-holiday in early October. For my past visit to Hong Kong, I used to stay in Hyatt Regency Sha Tin but this time, I choose Hyatt Regency Tsim Sha Tsui as this downtown hotel is located in downtown HK, which is very convenient for shopping. I stay in a Club King with exclusive service to the Lounge. The Lounge is excellent in the sense that you can have an excellent view on downtown Hong Kong & a full view on Victoria Harbor. It is a good place in watching firework there as well! The services provided in this hotel are excellent and the staff there make you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: AngelenoTravelers
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Deluxe Harbour View King room. The room was spacious and the view of the harbour was fantastic. Had dimsum in the hotel restaurant which was quite good, though a bit pricey. The roast barbeque pork was the tenderest I've ever had, delicious. The hotel staff was invariably polite and always present to help. Good location, walked to see the Symphony of Lights, and close to the MTR subway. Would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “BORING!!! Standard Hyatt Regency - could be everywhere”
Reviews.Author: HONkiev
Reviews.Content: Had to stay at the HR because my favorite hotels had been either occupied or very expensive due to exhibitions. The location is fine, near to Nathan Road - but located in the "bargain area" in a building with a strange (new) shopping mall which offers the cheaper brands. The entrance is curbside, no real stopping area for the taxi. Cars behind you will start to use the horn when you take out your luggage. You've to take the elevator to the Lobby floor and when you come out you first run into the (dark) restaurant/coffee shop. The decor of the hotel (lobby, coffee shop, rooms) is nothing else than BORING, standard, I would call it a better 3* hotel ambience. The rooms are standard, nothing special, the usual thing. You enter and have the bathroom on the side. Then you enter the room, bed on one side, TV on the other and on the end a desk and chair. BORING!!! The coffee shop is of dark wood, like many years ago (this is a new hotel!). When you leave the doorman is even unable to get you a cab, tells you to go (with your luggage) to the corner where it's easier to grab a cab. I'm very sorry, but nobody needs such an uninspiring hotel in a city full of great design hotels at nearly the same price, the W, LKF, MIRA.... My advice: below 1000 HK$ this hotel is okay - above: STAY ELSEWHERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “First Time in Tsim Sha Tsui...better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Keslergo
Reviews.Content: Date of Stay: August 29-30,2011 Room Type: Deluxe King Upgrade: none Reservation Method: Hotel Website Loyalty Card: Platinum Gold Passport Airport/Hotel Transfer: When traveling into Hong Kong, I've learned to just take the Airport Express since it's faster and very convenient. If you are staying 3 days or more, get the Tourist Pass which pays for the round trip fare and unlimited MRT rides for 3 days. Check in: The drop off was at the basement, which weirded me out a bit. You are greeted by the hotel staff as you get out of the taxi, you leave them to worry about your luggage while you go up to the lobby. Check in was okay, a bit longer than I hoped for considering there was only another guy checking in at the same time plus considering that I booked weeks in advance I wonder why they had to reprint my information sheet when I came in. Anyway too hungry to argue at that time so I just went to the room dropped by stuff and was on my way. Room: The room feels pretty standard, nothing really worth writing about. The bathroom though was nicer with a big shower stall and a nice tub. The walls could be opened to give a more open feel to it. Albeit a few years old, they were able to manage to keep it clean and updated which I really liked. Location: I have to be honest I'm not all that familiar with Tsim Sha Tsui since I usually stay at Causeway Bay or Central. The only reason why I decided to stay here is because I need to check out the camera shops before I leave for home the following day but since I was able to get a good deal in KL for the camera, I pretty much had nothing much to do. The hotel close to an MTR exit which is very convenient, it is also right on top of a mall with a few food outlets, you could walk to The One just around the corner for more shopping and restaurants. It's a good 10-15 minutes walk to Canton Road, I guess in the heat and rain it would be a little bit daunting but in November to March when the weather starts to get cold it would be a nice leisurely stroll. Breakfast: Breakfast was very nice, I didn't expect it to be this nice actually since it's a Hyatt Regency. I was impressed with how the place looked like and the offering was more than enough to keep you full for the entire morning. Check-out: Was thankful that the check out was faster than check in...there were cabs at the basement to take you directly to the airport of the airport express. Overall: It's a pretty good hotel, I wouldn't mind staying there again but I'm more of a Hong Kong Island type of tourist so I don't think I would stay again if given a choice.

Reviews.Title: “first class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Solotraveller888
