Reviews.Content: in the heart of tsim sha tsui you need to take an elevator to the lobby. downstairs there are la few high end shops. first class hotel as its quite new. although its on tsim sha tsui its located on saigon road and not the main street. shopping is limited and if you want more choices you need to walk 5 blocks to HARBOUR CITY and you can find vuittons, prada, gucci and almost everything. the bigget mall in kowloon. mtr a few steps away.

Reviews.Title: “What a Sensational Hotel”
Reviews.Author: welshwizardCanberra
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days after a Wendy Wu tour of Shanghai and Beijing. We stayed at the Regency Club level. Words like sensational come to mind and this covers the staff, the food, the Club, the ambiance, the location and the pool. The staff could not have done more to make our stay a happy one. The room was ready, cleaned and refreshed every day, the staff at the Club helped plan nour day and were always smiling and polite. The views were amazing. The life guards at the pool always acknowledging you as you arrived and left and attentive while you were in the pool. Location is within one block of Mathan Road and cwe walked to the MTR each time we needed to moev. My wife won a prize at the Kamll downstairs for her shopping skills! Hugos buffett was just so much to chose where do you stop. The bath was deep and welcoming, the towels soft and cuddly and the beds superb. We like Hong Kong and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Pickytraveler2
Reviews.Content: Used for a business meeting within hotel, so location not that important. Relatively close to airport..30 minute taxi ride. Be aware that there is another Hyatt farther out (Hyatt Sha Tin). Taxi drivers like to take you to the farthest one and then claim "mistake". Caught on to my taxi driver and directed him to Tsim Sha Tsui (plainly marked exits on freeways). Hotel was very comfortable for a 3 day business stay. Look for the "hidden" thermostat (behind the lamp near the bed). Couldn't find it the first night and room temperature was uncomfortable. Beds were hard, but common in China to have very firm beds. Hotel was relatively new and nicely decorated. The Cafe buffet breakfast and lunch was very good, except breakfast at HK$228 was over-priced. There is an on-site up-scale Western style restaurant, but didn't try it. Staff was courteous and efficient. No complaints, but no raves, either. I would probably stay again on next trip to HK.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: wakaj
Reviews.Content: Second stay here in 12 months. Friendly helpful service. 1 large room with 2nd interconnecting room, with harbour views-room size very decent and great value as second room was 50% of advertised rate. Hyatt reservation centre very helpful and held off our advance purchase payment due to unforseen circumstances. The breakfast buffet offered a good variety of food/good value and had a delicious meal the Chinese restaurant in the hotel. Would definitely stay at the hotel again

Reviews.Title: “location , location , location !!!”
Reviews.Author: DubaiBlossom
Reviews.Content: i stayed with my family in hyatt regency tsim sha tsui for 8 nights during late august and early september 2011 and it was such a nice experience. we have booked two deluxe connected rooms through phone call and the hotel sent the confirmation to my email immediately , i sent them an email few days before our arrival and asked them about the airport transfer their response was an email which included all the types of transportation i could use to arrive to the hotel ( taxi,mtr,hotel limo...) we chose the hotel limo which was around 800$. in the arrival hall in the airport the hyatt staff greeted us and took us to the car , the chauffeur told us that the trip to the hotel would take around 35 minutes and that was exactly the case. our check in was smooth and quick , the receptionist was really helpful and answered our inquiries with a wide smile. the rooms' size was pretty good neither too large nor too small , the mini bar was equipped with glasses , cups , plates , eating utensils and a water boiler . the only thing missing in the room was an iron and an ironing board but you can ask the guest service for them ,we stayed in the 17 th floor and our rooms had a great view of the city and the symphony of lights , the bathroom was clean and large and the toiletries were changed daily. the location is unbeatable if you want to stay in the heart of tsim sha tsui then this the place , the mtr station is just across the street and the k11 shopping mall is in the same building and it is easily accessible from the hotel's elevator, you can also access the mtr from the b3 floor ( as i remember ) in k11. our reservation was without breakfast so we only tried it once , the breakfast buffet was quite good but i have seen better buffets even in 4 star hotels , the bread and pastries selection was not too large and most of the main dishes were Chinese , although there was a vegetarian section it didn't have a large variety of dishes ( only hash browns and sauteed or baked types of vegetables ) , the only thing i liked about the breakfast is that the juice is freshly made in front of you . the hotel staff was helpful and well trained and the room service was also good . two things i didn't like about the hotel , first you have to pay for the internet but if you are staying for a long time take the 3 days plan it is much cheaper , second the lobby is too small and it always crowded and noisy .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui”
Reviews.Author: KFSKSP
Reviews.Content: Location: In the heart of TST as part of a huge and fashionable mall called K11. MTR station is right next to the hotel. There are plenty of restaurants and cafes of various kinds in the area, so you can easily eat out instead of paying ridiculously expensive hotel food. The hotel is the second stop of the free shuttle service provided by Airport Express Train coming from Kowloon Station. You can also take the shuttle to Kowloon Station if you want to take Airport Express to the airport. Room: Pretty good size by HK standard. Only inconvenience I experienced was the electric iron and ironing board were absent in the closest. So I had to call room service to deliver. Not a big deal, but this should a standard feature in any decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Hzqt1k
Reviews.Content: Once again the Hyatt has excelled in it's levels of service. Those in the US who think service is good need only travel to Asia to realize just how good it can be. The suite room was perfect and locaction excellent for going to the nearby markets.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to stay in Kowloon a good alterantive”
Reviews.Author: Peter E
Reviews.Content: Located just a 100 metres of busy Nathan road the Hyatt Regency TST is extremely well located. Its above the K!!! Art Mall ( whatever that means) but its a quick walk to train stations, the star ferry and the waterfront. There is a great supermarket in the basement of the mall to stock up on things if you don't want to use the minibar or room service. Its clean good bathrooms and a much cheaper Hyatt alternative to the Grand Hyatt on Hong Kong island.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hyatt in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_In_Dallas
Reviews.Content: There are several Hyatt properties in Hong Kong and I must say, this has got to be the best of them all. What I liked about it the most is - it is on the Kowloon side of the bay. You get an absolutely amazing view of the city but at a slightly lower rate than the Hyatt on the other side of the bay. The hotel is located right on top of an MTR station and a shopping complex, so it makes moving throughout the city easy. However, it is not on the MTR line for the Airport Express. You either need to take the MTR and transfer to Central Station or (what we did) take a quick cab from the hotel to Central and you can then catch the MTR directly to the airport. We were staying on the Club floor so upon checkin we were escorted up to the checkin team on that level. They were very gracious and operated in true high-style Hyatt form. Even better...we booked 2 nights since out flight out on the day of departure was at 5pm. Therefore, we wanted extra time to be able to come back to our room after a morning of touring so that we could freshen up before heading to the airport. When they found out that is why we had the extra night they refunded the points we used for that night and granted us a late checkout instead. We had breakfast in the lounge the morning of our departure. A great spread of food with great views of the downtown. While the room we were in was a tad small for our liking, it still had a great bathroom and very comfortable bed. It was definately a pleasant stay. All in all, we will be back and this is our "place to stay" when in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “A good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheTraveller2720
Reviews.Content: It was a confusing stay . Although I have no commendations for this hotel for tourists but I must say it's a very good business hotel. The rooms were small so was the bathroom . Room service was good but the pool and the spa were not so attractive. Being in the main shopping district was an advantage. The coffee shop was good but there were no other dining option and the elevators were terribly slow. So all in all it's recommendable for people on business and not on holiday

Reviews.Title: “Very nice central located hotel!”
Reviews.Author: samjonk
Reviews.Content: For those you like a good hotel in the TST area, the Hyatt Regency can be a good option for you. Unfortunately I don't know the pricing of this hotel, since I stayed in this hotel due to some problems at the airport with my connecting flight. The airline booked this hotel as a complimentary gesture for the discomfort, which I found actually very customer friendly! Instead of booking a lowcost hotel, I got this nice 5* central located hotel. I normally stay in The Langham on Peking Road, which I must admit I still prefer better, but The Hyatt would be a very good second place. The rooms are very new, clean and spacious. The shower is amazing! The only thing is really disliked was the elevators. There are elevators going from the lobby to the rooms. And then you have a different elevator for the lower levels (parking, street entrance etc.). This was very frustrating! The internet is very expensive 150 HKD per day. The buffet at the restaurant (lunch and diner) is marvelous!! I really enjoyed eating there, as a lot of others. The hotel is located next to Nathan Road, so easy access to shops and transportation. I didn't like the area at night. It didn't feel safe going outside by myself later at night.

Reviews.Title: “Graeat location”
Reviews.Author: Cliff-Ange
Reviews.Content: Hotel is lovely. Check in was efficient and quick. I was upgraded to an executive club suite which was on level 30. The room was huge with spectacular views of the bay of Hong Kong. The marble bathroom was massive with a huge show and deep bath tub. The bathroom walls opened up into the bedroom and you can have a bath and overlook the bay. The room had a complimentary nespresso machine and tea making facilities. No coin laundry in this hotel, only hotel dry cleaning which is a little expensive. The hotel is very central with the subway just minutes away. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best to Skip this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BizTravelFR
Reviews.Content: First off let me say, the property looks like a Hyatt. It says Hyatt on the building but unfortunately that's where the similarities to a true Hyatt property stop. I'm a frequent traveler and a Diamond Member with Hyatt. As such I've stayed in many Hyatt properties around the globe and sadly this one was a bit like entering an alternate universe. A world where Hyatt provides no service, is patronizing to its guest, and is completely apathetic if you stay with them or go elsewhere, they really could care less. This property has so many issues, fundamentally to do with the way it is managed. Unfortunately the complete lack of respect for its guest permeates throughout every senior manager at the property, from the General Manager down. It's truly tragic to see such a property run into the ground by its management. With that said, the glimmer of hope for this property is the physical building. The rooms are fairly adequate, most everything is in proper working order, and it shows fairly well. However, so do most properties in Hong Kong at this level. Hotel standards in Asia dwarf most other regions in the world. One comes to expect a beautiful property, a very comfortable well maintained room, and if anything….service! This hotel is almost inline with every other property in Hong Kong, but it lacks service. Not just the level of service you expect from an Asian hotel, but generic service in general and nothing close to what you would expect from a Hyatt property. There are many better properties on both the Kowloon and Hong Kong side that not only offer a better value, but aren’t so miss managed, and understand what the actual word ‘service’ means. As a top tier elite member with Hyatt if I couldn’t even get simple service myself, I would hate to see what passes for service with the general public without status or the occasional leisure traveler. Save yourself the hassle of a bad experience and just book into another hotel. The building seems alluring but it’s a bit like a Sirens call. Once you’re in you can’t wait to get out. The location is mediocre, the rooms are smaller than other properties in the area, the room rates aren’t overly competitive for the Kowloon side, and the staff is just difficult. To my fellow Diamond members, I can’t be positive this property even knows that Hyatt has an elite program, which is said considering they have a Gold Passport Manager on site. So if you arrive on property expecting typical Diamond or Platinum benefits you will be sorely disappointed. I was eventually given most of my Diamond privileges, but only after asking for them and then they try to sell it to you as if something already due to you is now provided as a brand new gift only for you. It was sort of like checking in and not having something simple like soap in the room. Then after asking for soap you’re told they charge for soap. Your response is all 5 star properties provide soap to their guests and they reply well we charge double the room rate for soap. Then numerous conversations later they key into the fact that you are an elite member with Hyatt and then they offer to make a one -time exception and give you soap, completely bizarre. So just as the title says, best to skip this hotel and book into one of the many better properties in the city.

Reviews.Title: “I HIGHLY RECOMMENDED THIS NEW HOTEL (2010) AND WILL BE BACK AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: Helen1201
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Hong Kong for a pleasure trip and stayed at this hotel. This hotel is excellent all around. It is conveniently located (close by to shopping), is easily accessible by foot and the MTR entrance is across the street. Excellent service from the bellboy, concierge, security personnel, front desk staff, managers to the housekeeping staff. It is new, clean, with oversized twin beds and the bathroom is HUGE with shower and oversize bathtub. The staff at this hotel is friendly and this hotel lives up to the Hyatt name. The staff smiles and greets you and even wishs you to have a good day. This hotel has high security, too. I felt very safe at this hotel. We even had this fabulous rom with a view of the harbor! We approached the reception area and the manager Gary Wong asked if he could help us answer any questions, etc. He was so helpful. Welcoming, personable, excellent all around. We be back again and again. I have finally found a place in Hong Kong that I am happy with and which can be home when I am away from home. P.S. There is a shopping center K11 only steps away with a convenient supermarket called the Marketplace on the lower level. You have to check this place out!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel when I'm in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: globbiztravel
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler I have become picky. I'm a Hyatt Platinum member and I have stayed at this property 3 times now and I keep returning. The staff is wonderful from arrival to departure. Everyone isprofessional welcomIng and friendly. The rooms are well appointed, spacious, great views and comfortable. Well equipped for business travelers as well. Hotel has MTR station underneath and connected as well for easy access. The food is very tasty and good. I always enjoy eating in restaurant or comfort of my room. Afternoon tea is also nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay great location”
Reviews.Author: Kez1955
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights on the club floor and it was a terrific experience. Hotel is very well located to everything on Kowloon with a subway stop nearby. Found it hard to leave club floor lounge each evening with stunning view over harbor and lovely food and drinks. Room tasteful and comfortable and club floor staff delightful.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel, I wish I don't have to leave.”
Reviews.Author: CalvinL88
Reviews.Content: First thing first, What a Fantastic Hotel. Best Location for food and shopping, an ultimate Kowloon-Side hotel. Wonderful staff, check in took less than 5 minute, Everything in the room was perfect, nice big bed, very nice bathroom, good movie selections, very fast internet. Had breakfast at the hotel, one of the nicest buffet I've had in a long time. What a wide variety and it was included in the room's rate. Also if have a chance do try Hugo the hotel's Italian restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Four Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cyan79
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days with the missus on one of her shopping spree vacations aka bank account clearance time. Value wise, it's a decent hotel. The rooms are spacious for HK and most important of all, clean. The room is tastefully adorned and the bathroom in good working conditions. Minor setbacks such as a leaky showerhead and a shower door that refuses to shut completely keep it away from the coveted 5-star status...but it's not too shabby. I mean, you get what you pay for. The service personnel are very friendly; however, broad smiles don't always translate to stellar service. We checked into the hotel at 2:00 PM, and were told that our bags would be brought up to our rooms. I then went to Macau in a failed attempt to win my money back from my last trip, and returned at 11:00 PM. The luggage was still not there...what the fruitcake...After calling the concierge repeatedly a few times; they finally brought it up to me. It was nothing major, but a bit disappointing considering it was the Hyatt and not Holiday Inn or Novotel. One thing that did really annoy me was that there was no free Wi-Fi or real business center. So for those unfortunate souls that need to do work, bring your own laptops. The Wi-Fi will also set you back you about 100HKD for 24-hour usage. Hotel food was decent, but you can always try authentic HK food from the varied restaurants in TST. The pool was a bit scrawny and the hotel garden was not much to look at, but that's just nitpicking. You shouldn't go to this hotel to enjoy the facilities anyways. It's just a place to rest after a tired day of shopping. In sum, not a bad stay, but I think I'll look around for another place the next time I'm in Tsim Sha Tsui.

Reviews.Title: “It was in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Dave_Barb32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hyatt Regency for 2 nights. We got a harbour view room on the 20th floor which actually did have a good view. We even watched the Symphony of Lights harbour show from our room one night, although we really enjoyed watching this on the avenue of stars down at the harbour front. The outdoor swimming pool is really good and so is the outdoor jacuzzi. The hotel room decor is nice and very modern, the bathroom was great - excellent shower. A downside was that the beds were really rock hard. We asked housekeeping for a bed topper pad which helped a little bit. We have found that in all our HK hotels the bed matresses have been really hard. The location of this hotel is the best thing, it is really close to the main Tsim Sha Tsui locations. Only a few minutes short walk to the Star ferry, waterfront, Nathan Road shops etc...It is an expensive hotel and we did not eat in the hotel restaurants as they were too pricey, but there is loads of nearby places to eat. We thought they should have at least provided a free morning newspaper.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent views...”
Reviews.Author: VfB 1893
Reviews.Content: We thought this to be a very cool city hotel. We loved the view from the Club Lounge and spent too much time there gazing at HKG island. We would definitely return to the Hyatt TST. The staff was doing everything to please us (Diamond Membership) and upgraded us to a corner suite which we thought was amazing. Bed, Bathroom, Room Service,...all was fine, and we thought it was a great choice to spend our money here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hong Kong experience”
Reviews.Author: Trueparisian
Reviews.Content: My friend and I absolutely loved our stay at the Hyatt Regency Tsim Sha Tsui. As Diamond members, we were upgraded (in advance) to a wonderful suite located on the top floors of the high rise (see the pictures posted of the room and bathroom). The suite was lovely. Everything was new, modern and stylish. Everything was at the right place. The bathroom was exquisite. The dressing was big. The sitting area was comfortable (nice expresso machine) and the bed was so comfortable. Needless to say, the view was breathtaking. The hotel staff is professional and reliable. Check-in and check-out was efficient. Maybe a little cold, but that's ok. The Chinese brunch on Sunday was AMAZING. We had breakfasts at the lounge which also has breathtaking views of the city. Breakfast was wonderful with a very large selection of excellent items. In the evenings, we would go to the lounge for apetizers and drinks. Everything was simply great and the staff was friendly and smiling. Items would re-stock rapidly when they ran out. LOVED the place. And, of course, it is conviently located, very close to a metro station. I would definitely return here. The rates are really affordable too!

Reviews.Title: “Great, modern, well-kept hotel in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: S3CR3T3X3C
Reviews.Content: OK. So I was of two minds writing this review: of course I wanted to share our experiences but it wasn't without a twinge of regret that I was letting everyone in on a "secret". The bottom line is that Hyatt in TST is one of our best finds in Asia. Hong Kong is a particularly tough nut to crack: there are some incredible hotels but they have Manhattan-like prices, there is the mid tier but those are....MEH, so it was a great pleasure to find that most elusive of all creatures: a great 5 star room in Hong Kong with good service at an incredible price in a great location. That, in short, is the Hyatt TST. The location is superb and it is a a nice, glossy, modern Asian hotel with clean, stylish accommodations. Pros: - Location, location, location!! - Modern & stylish - Clean - Nice service - Great breakfast - Awesome views from the harbor facing rooms Cons: - the service was not the very best -- a bit brusque and business-like versus warm - the hotel messed up a shirt of mine in the wash --- but... their manager made it up to me in Hyatt GP points... Nice :-) - NO spa :-( Overall, I heartily recommend the place and I will stay there again when in Hong Kong. So much nicer than staying on the Island -- you really get a feel for Hong Kong. I hope their management reads this and keeps up the maintenance. At the moment the new-ness of the hotel is pretty nice !

Reviews.Title: “Most everything you need”
Reviews.Author: myoda
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and clean with a large bed but just big enough to fit everything. The bathroom was extraordinary and about the same size, with a rain shower and two other shower heads, something you don't ordinarily get. Location was convenient, connected to the MTR, and walking distance to major attractions in TST. Hotel shares the building and facilities with private flats and sometimes get second treatment. Prices for extras (internet, restaurant) are a bit excessive but can be easily avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Great service hotel in midst of convenience and bustle of Tsim Sha Tsui”
Reviews.Author: Sogoesit
Reviews.Content: A, relatively, new Hyatt right in the middle of Kowloon without having to go all the way over to the Grand on the Island side. Could not be more convenient. Stayed during the Christmas shopping season and although the hotel was full the service, from the meeting at the airport (go to the Hyatt Desk in the Arrivals Hall where you will be taken care of at whatever level of transport service you require, from Limo to advice on public transport) to the changing of a room for a better one to the despatching of courier packages was handled seamlessly and with the utmost courtesy. Restaurants in the Hotel tended to be full, and expensive, at this time of year but room service was quick and immaculate and in the mall of the building, where the hotel is situated, and close-by in Tsim Sha Tsui there is all you could want in choice of cuisine and price. Breakfast buffet selection is great. Stayed for business and convenience and service were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel + Bad taste Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: travellinghorizons
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel and great rooms.. but they need to change their chef..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: ttc_8
Reviews.Content: All the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. When I first emailed the hotel to inquire about rooms, costs, and tours, I received a response within 24 hours. After arriving at the HK airport, we were greeted by the Hyatt airport staff who helped us arrange a private limo to the Hyatt Regency for approx. 680HKD. The check-in process was a breeze and our luggage arrived to our rooms almost immediately. The staff was very knowledgeable and they helped us navigate our way around HK. The food at the restaurant on the 3rd floor is delicious, and you get a complimentary mango pudding by being a Hyatt Regency guest! The harbour-view room was clean and spacious, and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was also spacious and the amenities were replenished daily. The only cons were that the closet space was limited and that there weren’t enough mirrors to check your reflection from head to toe. The hotel is conveniently located in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui with underground access to the MTR. It s also closely located to the malls K11 and iSquare with great restaurants and coffee shops. Overall, a wonderful stay! I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay”
Reviews.Author: mclachlan4321
Reviews.Content: I have always prefered staying on the island but this time felt like a change. Good decision. the hotel is located right above the TST MTR station, so very easy to travel around. the hotel is clean, modern and I found the service very good. I have often stayed at the Grand Hyatt on the Island, but the price is getting crazy over there and the place is becoming quite dated and stuffy. the upgrade to the club is well worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Ssgt_K
Reviews.Content: Our connecting flight was cancelled so we stayed a night here. What a hotel. The service, the food, the view... WOW!!! It is one of the most comfortable place we have ever stayed in. The only regret is: it's too far from the downtown core, so we had to take a taxi to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Beautiful Room, Amazing Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: KochamCie
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the hotel, checkin was quick and efficient and I went straight to my room which was absolutely stunning! A vast space with an amazing bathroom featuring a rain shower and a step in bath tub next to it. Lots of amenities where on offer as well as a double sided cupboard which could be accessed from the hall way and bathroom. The room was extremely clean and fresh with comfortable beds, large windows and a great selection of TV available. The buffet breakfast in superb value and probably the best I have come across with a huge selection on offer; freshly cooked from western to Japanese and Chinese. Wonderful coffee and great juices. Location wise, the hotel is at the K-11 Mall with lots of shops on offer and the excellent Illy Coffee Shop. It is moments walk from Tsim Sha Tsui MTR and close to the Avenue of Stars and Nathan Road. Overall, this hotel is superb, on par with the Langham Place Mong Kok, if not better is some aspects.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch!”
Reviews.Author: wasimmehr
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Rooms, Fantastic Service, Great food. Excellent Transport links. The lift changing thing can be a little frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice appearance, but lacking the polish”
Reviews.Author: northoc1
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Langham Place in Mong Kok. However, I thought I'd give the Hyatt in TST a try on this trip. I was leery because it was right across the street from the Holiday Inn Golden Mile and I didn't want to be bothered with the riff raff on the street. The location ended up being great. It has an MTR entrance via the mall below the hotel. There's a Marketplace in the mall so you can get food and water there. The drawback is that you have to take several elevators to actually get to the hotel. Kind of a pain, but no worse than Langham Place. I booked online and stated "No Adjoining Room" and also asked for a quiet room. Well, I got a room with adjoining door and on the other side of that door was a screaming baby.... for the entire duration of my stay. Very noisy and unpleasant. I had to hear the screaming kid and the screaming mom yelling at the kid. I also booked Club access. The Club itself looked great, but it might as well have been just a sitting area. There was no service to speak of, very little in the way of things to eat or drink. At Breakfast you had to go hunt down someone just to get a slice of butter. Selection of food was minimal. During the day everything stayed locked up except softdrinks. At Langham you get a beer and chips or snacks whenever you want it. They offered an evening cocktail service in the Lounge from 5:30-8pm. Langhams usually goes from 6-10pm. For the business traveller, the Hyatt hours are not adequate. I wouldn't get back to the hotel until 7:30 after a long day in China. That leaves you about 30minutes to try and grab something to eat and get a drink. Not adequate, especially for the price paid. The food selection was really minimal and there were no hot appetizers to be seen. The non-existant staff would bring by a single sample and then would disappear. I was used to Langham's great lounge service and quite often that would be my evening meal since all I wanted was something light. That didn't work at Hyatt. Oh, and the screaming baby was in the lounge everytime I went there...... The lounge looked great, and I guess the staff liked it too since they had the lights up so bright that you couldn't see out the windows in the evening. The stunning view that they have of the harbor was blocked out. So, I think that this could be a great place to stay but the staff seems to be so inexperienced and not really grasping the concept of what they are supposed to do. I'll try it again sometime, but for my next visits I'm going back to Langham Place Mong Kok. I'll give the Hyatt in Sha Tin a try also since its a much shorter train ride to the border.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay-excellent Hyatt experience”
Reviews.Author: kobri
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the hotel for 3 nights at the end of a very exausting business trip. We usually have stayed in the Island hotels, and have chosen the Hyatt Regency only because of a very good price deal. We never regreted this decision, moreover, we would definitely like to return. The hotel is pretty new, very clean, the rooms are big enough and bathroom is nice. The breakfast was great, everything you can desire, a lot of things freshly cooked for you. And if you have missed something, just go out to K11 Mall and you have a lot of restaurants and shops. The location of the hotel is perfect, you can walk to the most interesting places in Kowloon, Nathan Road only 2 minutes away, and you have a direct access to subway. The only minus issues were a really expensive Internet ( travelling in China for 2 weeks, everywhere Internet was free), and that the hotel have no spa and no sauna, only gym and outdoor swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel witheasy access to very where”
Reviews.Author: dbenamy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at the hotel on the last leg of a 28 day journey. The hotel upgraded us to a harbor view room on the club level.The hotel is very clean and one of the newest in this area. Close to the best shopping in the world, you can also walk under ground to most of the other shopping destinations in Tsim Sha Sui. The breakfast in the club was delicious and more than enough variety, the afternoon tea and cocktail hour was very nice as well. Hotel's in Hong Kong are expensive but considering free breakfast, internet,cocktails I think the hotel was a very good value. We paid including ax about $335 per US . Great for me because my wife could easily find her way to most of the shopping while I was working. look forward to our next visit. also great meal at Hugo's and lunch in Chinese restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A BEAUTIFUL HOTEL - 100% RECOMMENDED”
Reviews.Author: marigoldKent
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel after a sea cruise and before leaving home for Queensland. It had been over 30 years since we visited Hong Kong = so lots of changes. This Hotel really made our visit memorable - fantastic location: modern, bright, clean - facilities that could not be faulted in any way - and, above all, staff were welcoming, polite and professional. We arrived early in the morning and were checked in within the hour - also offered a late 2pm checkout on the day we left. Although in the middle of a very busy district of Kowloon, interior of the hotel: corridors, rooms were quite and restful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! Gracious staff and immaculate accomodation!”
Reviews.Author: gpad
Reviews.Content: As Americans travelling in Asia, the staff was gracious and welcoming upon our arrival and throughout our week long stay. The public rooms and our room were modern, immaculate and very comfortable. Set in an interesting lively area, it is a short walk to the Ferry and the MTR subway is conveniently adjacent to the hotel. In particular, I praise the concierge, Donald Cheung, who accomodated all of our requests from dinner suggestions/reservations to daily directions for our outings and even where to find specific purchases we wanted to make. He was our 'go-to' man and helped make our stay in gorgeous Hong Kong an amazing experience. Thank you Mr. Cheung!

Reviews.Title: “Top quality, good location”
Reviews.Author: SpiderUR05
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency TST for one night last December. The hotel was clean, the rooms modern, and the view was pretty nice (if it weren't for the smog). The hotel is situated on the mainland side of the bay, which wasn't a problem for us, but may be if you're looking to do more activities on HK island (like Victoria Peak). Although, the conceirge were very helpful in setting up a tour for us to take that brought us through the island, so we didn't really feel like we missed out. Hong Kong itself is crowded and dirty, but the hotel is anything but. We never felt rushed inside, or crammed in. The breakfast buffet was huge! And the quailty of the food was pretty good. No complaints there. I thoroughly enjoted the modern touches, like the key cards that you just waved by a sensor to open your door. Pretty cool! And the bathroom was also modern, which again I like. Overall, a quality hotel. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for TST”
Reviews.Author: OzCol1981
Reviews.Content: I usually stay on HK Island as that is where I need to be more work, however, this time I managed to get some good rates for the Hyatt at TST. For about $150 per night, it was a phenomenal deal. I wouldn't say this is the best Hyatt I've stayed in but for that price it was a great deal. Rooms are clean and new. Bed was comfortable, bathroom was decent sized and clean. I had an amazing view over Victoria Harbour looking back to Hong Kong Island. They also have a nice outdoor pool though it was too cold to use at the time but I suspect it would have an awesome view over the harbour. Location is great. You are part of a fancy new shopping mall and yet steps away from 'real shops' in TST. You are also right above the MTR so it was very easy for me to commute to and from HK Island. I found it a bit hard to find with its main lobby being higher up in the shopping mall. Reception and service was good as you would expect at a Hyatt in Asia though not great when you compare to the really elite chains.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, New and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Ms30
Reviews.Content: A taxi had to drop us off at the parkade. Once we entered, there is a small service desk that directed us to take the elevator to go up to the lobby. It was fine and well coordinated. The lobby is new and nice. When we checked-in, the concierge was very helpful. The hotel is joint to a mall, so there is easy access to restaurants, shops and a nice supermarket. Also, it is extremely close to the Tsim Sha Tsui subway/MTR. The location is great and it is even close to a couple of museums. The room is very new as well, with a flat screen tv and a smartly designed washroom. There was a small issue though. The toilet was plugged, but when we informed the concierge and it was rectified quickly. Other than that, the entire stay was very good and I would recommend this hotel. Also, there is a free shuttle bus the hotel offers. We took it to get to the Kowloon station and then took the airport express to the airport. The entire trip was comfortable, easy and convenient. In summary, the rooms are nice, the location is very convenient and the staff was very pleasant. Hope this review was helpful....

Reviews.Title: “A 5 star hotel with minor defects.”
Reviews.Author: juicetest
Reviews.Content: the furniture were torn and toilet seat needs changing. Its what you would expect with new hotels being exhausted.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, have stayed many times”
Reviews.Author: StressedOutTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel- it is relatively new and a decent location. The rooms are small, but I think this is standard in most Asia rooms. The customer service is excellent. The lobby layout is awkward, where the check in/out desks are on a different floor than the exit to outside. I like the K12 mall that is attached to the hotel- it makes it convenient to shop. Plus, there is a British market in the mall where I go to buy food if I don't want to pay $$$ for room service. I have stayed here for work probably 5 times and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing food, staff and views!”
Reviews.Author: Digito
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family as part of a travel and were amazed by everybody in this hotel. It seems there was an 'old Hyatt TST' that closed a few years back and this one opened not too far away from it's original location. As all hotels in Hong Kong, the rooms are not very big. The design is great though and I love the seating that is created in the window. Hugo's, the steakhouse has one of the best steaks I ever ate. Hope to be able to come back here soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, good service”
Reviews.Author: luxehip
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite new in a high-rise building in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui where the main shopping district in Kowloon area is. The room I got has a view to the city and it was very clean. The bathroom also has a view and it was very roomy. We got access to the exclusive floor and the breakfast selection was quite limited, that was the only draw-back but otherwise everything else was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value option in great location”
Reviews.Author: LilyLarkin
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Hyatt Regency Tsim Sha Tsui, we had just come from Grand Hyatt Macau, so it took a bit of getting used to the down-step. However, once we adjusted to that, we were more than happy that we were staying here. The hotel is wonderfully located in Kowloon - only 10 minutes walk from Hong Kong Harbour, the Avenue of the Stars, Hong Museum of History, and other key attractions, as well as a few minutes from the MTR and surrounded by shopping options and malls. Our room had been upgraded to the Club Harbour Twin, so we had the additional benefits that came with a Regency Club room, such as a bit more space, complimentary breakfast, alcoholic drinks and snacks in the early evening, and free internet usage in the private club lounge. While a little smaller than some of the other hotel rooms we'd stayed in, the room here was well equipped and comfortable. I loved the well-stocked bathrooms with toothbrushes, toothpaste, razors, combs and so on which is something we'd become accustomed to in Hong Kong - not something you get in many other parts of the world! The only real downside we felt was that WiFi in the rooms was not free, while so many other hotels offer it for free. We had stayed in a three star hotel where it was complimentary. The Hyatt Regency Tsim Sha Tsui has several restaurants, we ate at The Chinese Restaurant. I have to say, this was some of the best food we tasted in Hong Kong. I had jellyfish for the first time here - tasty! In all, I'd say that the Hyatt Regency Tsim Sha Tsui offers a great value option in a high-standard accommodation. Modern rather than plush, but definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and service”
Reviews.Author: BobKL
Reviews.Content: It's service with a capital 'S" in this hotel. The airport transport, the fast check-in, the alertness of housekeeping and the service in the restaurant, all very good. Apart from that rooms are nicely modern with all the comfort you would like to have in 2010. Location is great, on top of a shopping mall (and with many more at a close distance) and of the MRT station. What would have made it an undisputed 5 star rating? Something extra, the personal touch, the surprise. No complaints here, would definitely stay there again next time, but would love to see the service go 'beyond the book'.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel ! Will definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: evelyn_sg
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel to stay in. Booked Deluxe king and twin which are connecting. Bathrooms are big and two children can bathe at the same time. Hotels provided complimentary basic baby amenities including pram, bath tub, high chair and cot so it was great for my baby. Stayed on 11 floor and had a good view of Hong Kong Island. Hotel also has MPV transfer for my Family of 3 adults and 3 children plus 5 large luggages which is very spacious and convenient if you are travelling with young children. Close to MTR and excellent subway web to major shopping and attractions. It is practically smoke free using the subway. Excellent Hotel ! Will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money and situated excellent as well”
Reviews.Author: anthonyholland
Reviews.Content: Visiting China for family purpose, we started our roundtrip in Hong Kong and stayed 5 nights here. This newly opened Hyatt Regency is situated ideal, close to MTR Stations and Shopping Malls, Museums, Ocean Terminal and Harbour City. Excellent starting point for excursions in and around Hong Kong. Rooms are spacious and restaurants have stunning views on Hong Kong Island and Victoria Harbour. The Hotel has a Fitness Centre and an Outdoor Swimming Pool. The hotel has 4 restaurants with a very broad choice of dishes from all over the world. And for those who upgrade to business level and lounge: an excellent choice! And last but not least not to mention the very friendly service and the kind and helpful staff. It is no punishment to stay here for a long time…. We had a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: Escapefromthedesert
Reviews.Content: Spent the Thanksgiving day at the Hyatt and it was a great week. If you are coming from the Hong Kong Airport, take the Airport express which is about 14 USD, it will take you to the Kowloon Station and there you hop a free shuttle bus the K3 direct to the hotel. The hotel is in an ideal location in the Tsim Sha Tsui, it is directly over a metro stop that will take you to all parts of greater metro Hong Kong Area. It is within walking distance to the night market, Jade Market, the Ladys market, habor city and the promenade. Checkin was easy, I arrived at 900A and me room was ready. Marcus was friendly, helpful and forthcoming with inforamation. The Deluxe rooms are nicely furnished and roomy. There is interesting moveable wall between the sleeping area and the bathroom that allows viewing of the TV while shaving or using the facilities. If you ask for a high enough room you should be able to get a great view without paying out of pocket. They have a great Rainshower facet in the bathroom for showering. The first day we noticed that the shower was not draining and we had a mini-flood. When we called the technican he unsealed the drain. When we returned to the room the next afternoon there was a musty damp smell. It wasn't overpowering nor intoxicating like others have reported, but rather like the smell of clothes that haven't dried correctly on the clothes line. I have had the same problem with the Ritz Carlton in Singapore, the Shangri-La hotel in Bangkok and severall resorts in Mexico. I think it is a problem with the piping in humid climates. It did not warrant a room change for me, but I could see if someone who was hyper sensitive to smells could be irrated. Also, do not fret when you don't see a coffee pot in the room as the hotel will deliver free brewed coffee to you room on request in the mornings. The gym was always empty, the equipment was top rate and had TV's on each piece. Bottled water was provided free. While in the gym there was aleast one staff member that checked the gym for upkeep. We ate the breakfast buffets as we could not find a place that served a full breakfast prior to 900A in that area. The area has a hughe slection for lunch and dinner choices at reasonable price. You can find anything from a MacDonalds to Dim Sum within a 5-10 minute radius. The staff was always present and friendly. I have an issue with a check-out that I will address with Hyatt Customer service, but it is not worth implacting their overall reputation as it is regarding my bill. They didn't seem to have an official concierge desk, but the staff seemd willing to offer information.

Reviews.Title: “new hotel”
Reviews.Author: mos505
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new hotel, with the resultant advantages and hitches. The rooms are comfortable and extremely modern, although the bathroom feels more spacious than the room itself. Views from basic rooms are nothing special, mostly nearby buildings; however the harbor is partially visible from suitably oriented rooms on top floors, but as the hotel is somewhat inland, it is not worth the premium as in waterfront hotels. Staff appears to be trying hard, but some more experience will probably help smoothing out the experience. Location is relatively convenient, with most necessities within reasonable walking distance, even if not next door.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: CRobyn
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 7 nights and was very impressed with this hotel. Registration was very easy and staff excellent. The room, with a lovely harbour view, was excellent. The room was a good size and lovely decor, bathroom was good size with luxurious shower and rain shower, sliding doors over sink opened to show views. Bed was excellent, room was quite and room very clean and well serviced. Room service was very good, extra towels arrived very promptly. Restaunts and breakfast was very good. We were pleasantly surprised that the hotel is so very well located (better than it appears on maps) easy walk to Harbour, other Hotels, shopping malls easy access to Jordan Road and then to markets etc The staff were excellent, especially Kit and Jimmy. They recommended a good tour to get us started in Hong Kong, a great local area of fish restaurants, booked and recommended great restaurants (Aqua has great harbour views and good Italian and Japanese food - got great window seats), and gave directions to Ocean Park and other attractions. Thoroughly recommend this hotel if you want a bit of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel with sewage problem on certain rooms”
Reviews.Author: ching17
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really new, it has a mall and is connected to the subway. Very accessible. The only downside is that we were given a room with a smelly bathroom/toilet. We believe it is a sewage problem as the smell worsens every time we flush. We mentioned this to the staff/,manager, but he simply denied the pungent smell. We were four families and of the 4 rooms, only our room had the problem. It seems that the problem occurs only to certain portions of the hotel. The hotel did offer to change our room, but since we only stayed 2 nights and have already spent 1 night there, we decided to not change rooms anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a family of 5”
Reviews.Author: wakaj
Reviews.Content: It was great value for us as Hyatt allowed us to book a second room at 50% off on their Family Plan Rate. At any other hotels, we have to book 2 rooms because the hotel does not allow us to have more than 3 in a room. The room they gave us was the corner room (which was very roomy) and the interconnecting room next to it. I could not find any serviced apartments for 4 nights in HK so this was the next best thing. The kids loved the swimming pool which we had to ourselves most of the time and there is even a small play area for my 3 y.o. next to the pool. The staff was very helpful in suggesting restaurants and also recommended a tailor where my husband had an excellent suit made. My sister and her friends who arrived in HK after us also used the tailor-Linda Chow. The staff were very helpful during our stay and their high level of customer service continued even after we had left. We had to call them 1 week after check-out to check if a pair of prescription sunglasses was found in our rooms and they provided us with an email confirming the loss for our insurance company. We will stay at the Hyatt again -maybe even next year when we go back to HK.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: yellowsurfer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in The Masterpiece Tower, and has access to K11, which is a glitzy mall. Early arrangements were made by my party to be picked at Check Lap Kok (HK Int'l Airport). Two gentlemen were already waiting for us as we stepped out of the gate, where they offered to push our carts and carry our luggage. They led us to our waiting minibus, which then took us directly to the HRHK. They transferred us to the care of two other hotel staff, who took us directly to our rooms. Since we had four rooms, the staff walked us through each room to make sure we were happy with the rooms and their proximity to each other. Our luggage was brought up in a matter of minutes and brought into our rooms. We had two regular rooms and a connected pair of rooms, which were beautiful, super clean, and looked brand new. Our room had two twin beds, lounge chair, plasma TV, and luxurious glass and marble bathroom. Best of all was an incredible view of the HK skyline, which we had from each of the rooms. We ate a couple of times at the hotel buffet downstairs, which served high-quality food, from dim sum, seafood, Chinese, Indian, and other fare. Location is in the middle of everything, and subway access is directly below the hotel. Ranks at the top of comfort, service, and quality of stay that we've experienced.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Wherever the cheap fares take me
Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good location, good staff”
Reviews.Author: antonius66
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights at the end of September and used a Hyatt Diamond Suite upgrade. We were upgraded to a basic suite, but had to pay more if we wanted a Harbor View suite. The Grand Hyatt in HK gives a Harbor View suite that is about 2x as large I believe as the standard Diamond Suite upgrade, which tempted us, but was more money. Overall, we were very pleased. Check in was easy and efficient, although the taxi drivers often have trouble finding the place. We were taken to the club floor and checked in, and taken to our room. A very nice suite with a bedroom that was sealed off from a little living room and the bathroom. Bathroom was nice and large with seperate rain shower and tub. The bed overlooked the city and had a nice view. Overall the room was clean and comfortable. The club was nice and the staff friendly. Breakfast was a basic continental but was decent enough with pastries and juices, along with a little yogurt, salmon and cold cuts. Evening canapes were nice with a few hot dishes and drinks. Staff asked if we needed help or assistance with the city and asked how our trip was going. Check out was very easy and efficient with no issues. No unexpected charges or problems. The hotel location was good as the Tsim Sha Tsui metro line is inside the same building as the hotel, as well as a little mall with a tasty bakery and supermarket for food items. You can get pretty much anywhere quickly and easily from the hotel metro location so it is centrally located. Overall very clean, friendly and a decent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and the weird”
Reviews.Author: Aviron
Reviews.Content: Six days at this hotel. Conveniently located right next to a MTR entrance, 2 blocks from Nathan Road and the harborfront. The good: location, lobby staff, room service, breakfast buffet, the view, bottled water, airport shuttle stop, nice pool area*. The bad: obscure “main” entrance on a small street, no lobby to speak of, *no towels at pool area or use of the “members only” locker room and health club. The weird: tiny trash cans, housekeeping that rearranges the way you leave things (clock, robes), large closet with no shelves, glass bathroom partition, smallish room size, *exterior stair pool access.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel but Problems with some staff”
Reviews.Author: sanandjezz
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the Hotel after taking the airport shuttle train/bus, we checked in at around 5.00pm and were initially a little disappointed with the receptionist's first question which was "what time will you be checking out". Bearing in mind we hadn't even checked in and were staying for 5 nights this was not good. The room was spacious with a Harbour View but had little storage areas for longer stays. Bed very comfortable. Great bathroom with large walk-in shower and separate bath. Nice and spacious pool area with large pool and jacuzzi. Very uncomfortable bamboo loungers though. The pool was on the 8th floor but you could only access via the 9th floor as the 8th floor was a reception area for the apartments. Consequently, every time you used the pool, you had to sign in and out which was a bit tedious and made us feel a little like second class citizens against the apartment owners. One major problem we had was on returning to our room one day at around 5.30pm to find that it had not been serviced. This is the last thing you want to find after a day of sightseeing and sunbathing. We immediately alerted reception to this and, eventually, a young man arrived but the cleaning he did (or didn't do) was so bad we had to complain again. The manager arranged for the room to be serviced again after we had gone out and left some complimentary wine and fruit. This was a nice gesture but, still, it is not the service you expect when paying £200.00 per night. Overall it was a good stay in a good location but I would think a little more carefully about booking with Hyatt again. As a postscript, when checking out, we were not even asked if we had had a nice stay! Public and guest relations need some work.

Reviews.Title: “A killer combination of Luxury and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: 5shyams
Reviews.Content: If there is one thing I love in a good hotel, it is that killer combination of luxury and comfort! And that is something I found in abundance in Hyatt Regency. The location is fantastic, right opposite to the MTR station, 2 stops away from the Central area. The food is great, the Cantonese cuisine is a must try!! The staff is ever-smiling and very friendly... something that always acts as that icing on the cake!! All in all, a great experience... m definitely coming back!

Reviews.Title: “can't be faulted”
Reviews.Author: forward_cabin
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt has just opened. I spent 4 nights there in the Regency Executive Suite, Harbour View level 24 the top floor of the hotel. Not all hotels now in HK have great views and if you need to be on the Kowloon side then this is the place to be. The upgraded service in the lounge provides a good breakfast of local or western food, the gym is a little light on for equipment but has runing, step, free weights and benches, in room Hyatt yoga plan too. The pool is a bit tricky to get to as the property is shared with the residents on floors 25-60 and the pool is on level 8 but entry is on level 9... Service is outstanding, standard of my rooms was the same, good desk, amazing array of accessories and kit to charge all types of phones and IT you may have... Location is good and connected directly into the mall next door will take you directly onto TST East MTR station. great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning rooms and great location in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Crazy33Italy
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hyatt as it’s brand new hotel in Hong Kong and actually it shows! Check in was a smooth one, we arrived in town with the Airport Train express and then a small bus picked us up at the station and took us straight to the hotel. The hotel is in the K11 building, a brand new shopping mall and in my view the best shopping mall of the area with lots of great restaurants: tried STEIK WORLD where I had the best tenderloin of my life!!! And also HAMA (great sushi!) and the Ginza Bairin (just ok). It’s so handy as you can have an evening dinner with no need to rush as there is a huge choice just a few elevators stops away! Also the hotel is in a great location and the underground is below the hotel. I had booked a Harbour View room on a high floor including breakfast. The view I am sure it is better from other hotels like the Intercontinental and the Peninsula, but they do cost more too. At the Hyatt you have a few buildings in the way but you still have a nice view. The room was the best! Brand new, very large flat screen TV with lots of channels, but the bathroom was even better: huge with walk in shower and there is also a bathtub (but only used the shower as it was the best shower I have ever seen!), the furniture is so modern and the mirror opens up to the bedroom so you can see the view of the harbour from the bathroom. Also there are so many nice toiletries and lots of soft towels apart from bathrobes and slippers. Breakfast was the part I enjoyed the less….choice was ok, but food was not the greatest, just ok. Especially the fruit and cake area: there was food on display in the windows below the actual food you could have and they did not match…food on display obviously looked more yummy… The coffee was a nightmare: the first day we were there I asked for coffee but never showed up…in the meantime I could see coffee being served to other guests who had arrived after us…so I asked and I asked again….nothing…so I went to one of the waiters myself who was standing next to the coffee machine and asked if I could make my own coffee and he said only waiters were allowed….so I told him I had been waiting for half an hour for it….after 10 more minutes the coffee finally arrived….and it was bad too! Anyway the following day I think I was recognized as the coffee lady and the coffee was always there for me! At least they realized it…. I am pleased with my stay at the Hyatt and would stay there again if I were in HK (don’t know if I would care for a harbour view room though). I think the other hotels did not compare or were more expensive and not worth the extra money. And K11 is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Still one of my favourite till now”
Reviews.Author: CoconutHeadHongKong
Reviews.Content: It's a nice 4.5 star hotel in Masterpiece building. The room is big (for HK standard) we always request for the corner unit since we need extra bed for my girl. I like the huge bathroom and the two way wardrobe which makes it convenient when you need to retrieve clothing after shower. Staff are friendly but the housekeeping may be a bit slow when the hotel is fully packed. Just a small complaint about the taxi drop off point. I totally agreed with the other review, most of the HK taxi driver don't know that it's in the basement so if you enter thru the main door, it's like practically nobody help you with your luggage. I think proper signage is needed badly and service can be improved by station some bell boy at the front. The hotel rate has gone up by 15% since my last stay in Feb. I hope that the hotel managment should look into giving bigger discount for returning customer or golden passport member. Shopping is very convenient and there is supermarket at basement of K11. MTR is right at the basement. You can move around even in typhoon or rainy session.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and great location”
Reviews.Author: goldencelt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient for shopaholics! It sits above a great shopping centre K11, which has all boutiques you would love, plus huge supermarket in basement. It is located 6 or 7 minutes taxi ride to Ladies market and 2 minutes walk to Nathan Road shopping and 10 minute walk to the Ferry terminal! Hotel rooms large, everything very clean and staff go way beyond the expected in service, to make everything about your stay comfortable. Management highly viisble at all times and the hotel runs like a well oiled machine. Will book there again when next in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel But Difficult to Get Cab”
Reviews.Author: tiburon17
Reviews.Content: Finally! After hearing about it form these many years, have decided to stay at Hyatt Regency Tsimshatsui after years of staying at another 4-star hotel in the Mongkok district. (Have heard comments that it was pretty old...) This hotel does not come with a drop-off driveway on the street level. Should one not stayed at the hotel before, chances are the cabdrivers will likely alight you along the street and you will need to drag your luggage into the hotel through a side door. It didn't help that the hotel level not at street level...you will need to take the elevator. The lobby is typical of any regular hotel...not too grand...just regular. The front desk informed me that they had got a double bed for me although I had requested for a single King-sized bed when I made my reservations. Fortunately, the front desk officer did not insist that that was the only roomtype available and took the initiative to give me requested room through an upgrade. The room is clean, came with a 54" LCD TV, beautiful bathroom and full glass windows. Although I was on level 12, there was not much view...view from room consisted of office building across the street, rooftops of neighbouring buidlings and view of the skyscrapers through gaps between buildings. Guest service response, called from the room phone, was fast. Although, thinking back, no one came forward to help me with my luggage during both check-in and check-out... Though it's a brief walk away from the main shopping area along Nathan Road as well as Peking Road, it's also interesting to walk around the individual shops around the hotel. The hotel is also connected to a new shopping mall called K11 which has a supermarket. Across the street, you have 7-11. The hotel houses a few F&B outlets...The Chinese Restaurant serves delicious tim sum...but, of course, not cheap. Variety of food are available around the hotel...so no problem getting a good bite. The major downside of this hotel was getting a cab. Found that out when I was trying to get a cab to the airport. As it was raining, I was directed to the hotel drop-off/pick-up point - which happened to be in the basement. Thus, do pray that the bell-hop, on level one, is hardworking enough to get onto the street to direct cabs to drive down to the basement. I was third in cab queue and it took 15mins for my cab to turn up. Alternatively, you may take the shuttle bus from hotel to the Airport Express Station in Kowloon Station. The shuttle takes 15mins from hotel to station. This will be ONE of the hotels I will consider when I visit Hong Kong. But there are a handful of hotels, within the vicinity, that offer lower or similar hotel rate...and similar service level.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: LondonTealady
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at this hotel. It was everything you'd expect from a Hyatt in Asia from great food to unbelievable service!!. A clear example of the level of service was when we left to catch a flight to South Korea. When we arrived at the train station, my partner discovered he had left a letter from the embassy (which would facilitate his passage after his passport was damaged by the Chinese) at the hotel. Basically, we couldn't travel without it but we also didn't have time to go back. When we rang the Hyatt they actually put a member of staff in a taxi with the letter. They arrived on time for us to catch the train and flight, and didn't even want to take any money for the taxi ride (we insisted!!). Remarkable, remarkable service and wonderful people!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hoops7k
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt is a great hotel in a great location. The rooms were very new and they have a great design. I had a amazing view over looking the harbor. Most of the staff were great and helpful except one of the check-in people didn't know the rules to the gold passport program a refused me lounge access. This was quickly changed when I walked away and another guy came and got me and told me he was wrong. The only complaints I have is the entry & the cold showers. You have to take two elevators to get to your room (which during busy times can be slow). I never could seem to have a warm shower in the morning. I think the rooms are nicer then the Grand Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel really nice, just wanted to let others know about the visa service offered.”
Reviews.Author: HenBoz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exemeplary, clean , well maintained with all the amenities. We had a good stay here. Dont get the hotel to organise your China Visa as they charge $1000HK. You can go to the border and buy the visa on site for $200HK.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Hyatt Regency Property”
Reviews.Author: SwedeClark
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at the new Hyatt Regency in Tsim Sha Tsui Hong Kong on the Kowloon side. Wonderfully located to restaurants, subway, and ferries this property is set on top of a lovely new mall with unique stores (not the usual you see over and over). The food offerings in the mall are delightful...seafood, steak and Asian specialties. The food and beverage (F&B) offerings at the hotel are the usual steller Hyatt offerings. A well arranged and diverse all-day-dining cafe as well a stunning restaurant on the lobby level. The bar on the 3rd level called Chin-Chin is a gorgeous and relaxing palce to have a quite drink without the crowds. The gym was under renovation unfortunately and I was sent down the street to a locals health club...not pleasing at all. I hope they have their gym back on line soon. All-in-all a definite place to return to....once the gym is finished!

Reviews.Title: “So Convenient, so fresh!”
Reviews.Author: yotravel
Reviews.Content: A sparkling new hotel in TST Kowloon with comfortable rooms and a very chic modern feel. Minutes from the buzzing Nathan Road and Harbour City and within very easy reach of the tube station, which can easily be accessed from within the hotel itself. My colleague's room also had a Nespresso machine - delightful! Sadly mine was bereft of one but I should not be complaining as his was luckily a higher category room. There is an ILLY coffee shop in the complex and serves amazing coffee and treats. Enjoy! Breakfast in the hotel is nice as is the Chinese restaurant. Did not land up using the room service! K11 the shopping mall is so new and connected to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We're serious when we say "We'll stay here again"”
Reviews.Author: shirotan
Reviews.Content: LOCATION - is great! We chose this hotel because it's got an MTR entrance under its building, and it takes 3 min from that entrance to the platform. - there's a huge supermarket and a shopping mall K11 adjacent to the hotel, and many 7-11 and local restaurants around the area ROOM - is good size. Not too small. And is decorated in a nice, modern way. - The view from my room wasn't wow, but everything in my room was great that it compensated the view BATHROOM - Is equipped with the best bathroom fixtures i've ever used. Not the first time i've stayed in a hotel with Hansgrohe products but it was a different experience using them here, particularly the rain shower. - The layout is good. It's got the wardrobe back door so we can get our clothes without having to walk out the door. SERVICE (4.8 out of 5) - Front, bell and concierge were top-notch - Guest services gave me a wrong internet password - As for Housekeeping -- i found a plastic seal of bottled water lying on the floor the moment i stepped into the room. -- Also, used note pad on working desk was still in its place, hidden under the notepad cover. -- Cotton buds were not replenished on the first day. -- And body lotion on the second day. - Small dust ball flew out of the back door wardrobe on the first day. - Housekeeping manager did send us wine and some apples and apologized on the first day. Despite those insignificant human errors, we were really happy with our stay. And will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One word "Wow!!!"”
Reviews.Author: napawan
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights there in June and could not be happier! Everything was perfect from sparkling new and clean room, excellent staffs, and the best location. Rooms: we have 2 rooms and 1 suite and all of them are comfortable. Small improvement is to get the outside windows clean. Excellent staffs: they treated us like valuable guests (I am diamond at Hyatt). Requested a box of ice once and it was there every night afterward. Asked someone at the front desk for direction and he walked us outside to make sure we won't get lost. Location: It is in the center of everything. The hotel is on top of a new shopping complex with great japanese supermarket. To get on the subway, you just go to the basement level and it is seamlessly connected. This is the hotel you don't want to miss when staying in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “This is a seriously good hotel”
Reviews.Author: GrumpyMeg
Reviews.Content: I had a bit of fun trying to choose between several hotels in Tsim Sha Tsui, but I'm glad i chose this one. It is modern, clean, well designed and the staff are incredibly courteous and friendly. Its not often that staff are genuinely impressive as they make the' extra effort' but that was my experience with this hotel. The reception was good and the doormen ubelievably helpful.The room was one of the best I've ever stayed in - the bathroom impressive in its design and contemporary feel. The only small gripe I have is that the windows could be a bit cleaner - apart from that everything, and I mean everything, exceeded expectations in every possible way. Rarely have i ever encountered such an all-round good package. Well done Hyatt Regency I will be back! If only the hotels Ive stayed at recently in Europe were this good...

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: ami14
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay there again. Great hotel, very close to subway and shopping centres. The staff very helpful and hospitable. This must be the newest address in Hongkong with modern and elegant interiors. Look for harbour facing rooms which gives you mind blowing view in the night. You just can't take off your eyes from the amazing scenery. Only thing that baffles you is very expensive breakfast. Otherwise one of the better hotels in Hongkong.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location and everything was brand new”
Reviews.Author: mauiguys
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was the first on our Hong Kong / Macau Trip and we loved it! The grocery store / shopping center / subway access in the basement was great! Take a Taxi from the airport because it's so cheap but then get your octopus card and use the subway for everything else. You can even use your octopus card to buy groceries! What an awesome idea! Our first trip to HK was in 2005 and we did find that the bargains weren't as plentiful as before but oh well... All three Hyatts we stayed at were no more than two years old! Very cool.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shy33
Reviews.Content: i have always stayed in the Hyatt Sha tin wich is also a good hotel by if u go via location the Hyatt at tsim is better its close to the shopping area and its easy to go and come from the malls there are a lot of indian restaurants around so u can get ur fravourite food when ever u want the staff is great very good hotel

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: shakungifts
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel in may 2010 .Newly opened hyatt hotel just behind holiday inn hotel . The rooms are very nicely done up although not very big but pleasent the staff is warn and cordial the best is the location so central still quite and better than the noisy nathan street

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: HamburgBowmore
Reviews.Content: First time in this hotel, we got upgrade to a suite. Average size, okay view. The regency club on the 23rd floor is nice, although not comparable with the one of the Grand Hyatt Hong Kong. We had a problem with the electricity in part of our room around 11:00 PM. They immediately send two technicians and fixed it in 5 minutes. Overall a good hotel to stay in Tsim Sha Tsui side.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Vipulsharma123
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel with Great Location. Close to MTR and main shopping areas. Close proximity to the Bay. Excellent location for a leisure / holiday stay. Staff was very friendly and the Concierge was simply the best. They had the right suggestions for all our requests. Great views from the higher floors. The Regency Club is just great with great views too and the staff super. Look forward to being there again.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel Excellent Standards”
Reviews.Author: Diveguide
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Regency in TST for a week in may 2010, hotel has been open 6 months or so. Level of staff to customers is very high always found someone to help before I got to desks, when I used the concierge service was first class. Door staff recognised you coming along the street and had doors open as you got to them welcoming you back bit cheesy but made you feel welcome stayed in a Harbour view King views were tremendous with only 1 building in the way of seeing the whole of the Hong Kong side of the harbour, watched light show from our room a few times. Bathroom had a rainshower and a sliding mirror so you could look at the view from the bathroom. Bed was huge and comfortable, a little short of wardrobe and drawer space was my only criticism Entrances to TST east Station and TST station below the hotel, Knutsford terrace a short walk - 10 mins, Nathan Road - 5 mins, star ferry depending on lights on crossings -15-20 mins Excellent selection of bars and restauraunts around the hotel although they were a little quiet midweek All round an excellent hotel I would stay there again in a heartbeat and recomend to friends

Reviews.Title: “excellant , holiday, only wish i had stayed for 2 more days”
Reviews.Author: tripplanner74
Reviews.Content: Excellant location, centrally located, close to MTR station, nice area, very close to shopping, good food joints and entertainment.apt for a vacation. Nice rooms, very helpful and efficient staff ... especially concierge/ travel desk .. who planned out our daily trips for us.... on the whole..excellant , holiday, only wish i had stayed for 2 more days...

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly impressive with a terrific location”
Reviews.Author: WanderingOutdoors
Reviews.Content: Firstly, my partner works for Hyatt in Australia and the accommodation is complimentary as part of the staff perks, although we did pay to be upgraded to the Regency Club. The hotel has been open for approx 6 months, opening in Oct 09 and was immaculately presented. Time will tell if this is maintained or not. The location was great, an access to the East Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station is literally 20 metres from the front door, and a quick walk to Nathan Road and the ferry terminals. The room, albeit small, was well presented and comfortable - a great nights sleep was had each of the 3 nights we were there. Although, considering this is HK, not much time was spent in the rooms other than for sleeping and dropping off shopping before venturing back out... The Regency Club was fantastic, and had a most impressive view of Hong Kong Island (although the hotel is not located at the top of the mixed use building). Having paid for the upgrade to Regency Club, we received complimentarty internet access, continental breakfast, pre-dinner drinks & canapes. The Sky Garden was also impressive, with a great gym and pool area. The restaurants were well presented, but we chose not to dine at the hotel instead hunting out local restaurants to enjoy the local flavours (& were not disappointed - would recommend Tsui Wah and Fairwood Restaurants). Check in and check out were quick and staff were extremely efficient, polite and personable. If I had to come up with a complaint, it would be that the windows needed cleaning, although this in no way inhibited the views (although it was rather hazy whilst we were in HK) and the night light in the room was located under the bathroom basin, away from the glass panel between the bedroom and bathroom... not that these were big issues, but as mentioned, if I had to come up with a complaint - but this in no way affected the level of enjoyment of our stay. The hotel is perfectly suited to business people, but we are looking forward to returning on our next holiday.
