Reviews.Title: “Great choice. Excellent hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: in2travelling
Reviews.Content: After staying at another 5 star hotel in the Tsim Sha Tsui area of Hong Kong for 15 years, I decided to try out the Hyatt after the hotel rates at my usual hotel became outlandish. I was very very happy with the change. The hotel is very well located. The rooms clean and comfortable, the staff friendly and the hotel management bent over backwards to ensure the stay was to my pleasing. The rooms are well layed out. The bathroom well designed with a rain shower that is the best I ever had. The one downside is that there isn't a lobby. Also since the main entrance for the hotel is not on ground floor, having someone drive to pick you up at the hotel is not as simple as other hotels. But the hotel is right in the heart of things and is above a mall which has an upscale food store. Entrance to the hotel is limited to guests and the elevators will only be activated by a room key. Work out facilities are basic but more than adequate. Equipment is new and of good quality although there is not a lot of it. I am very comfortable recommending this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable service”
Reviews.Author: Global_vagrant
Reviews.Content: Well located new property on the Kowloon side of Hong Kong. This hotel is pulling out all the steps to makes its mark in the very competitive HK hospitality sector. Service is impeccable and I came away a truly delighted customer. Of particular note was an experience on dining during my one evening at the hotel. Feeling tired after a few days hectic business, I wandered into the coffee shop and waited as a waitress scampered off to find a free table in the busy dining room. A hotel employee on passing the restaurant entrance enquired if I was ok at about the same time the waitress returned with the news of a 30 minute wait as they were full. The gentleman immediately offered to take me to the bar to wait. He proceeded to chaperone me down one level to the excellent hotel bar and offered me any drink on the house before shooting off to find a copy of the day’s paper for me to read while I waited. The employee in question, Ric Tam, the Manager of Room Service, truly went out of his way and exceeded my expectations as a hotel guest. For that I thank Mr Tam and applaud the hotel for its highly motivated staff. In terms of the accommodation, the room had all the features to be expected of a hotel in this class and of this young age - although it should be noted that the room size and space is rather limited. This does not align with other reviewers who suggest spacious rooms – perhaps I was unlucky and there are rooms of varying size. However be warned. Notwithstanding, my stay was very pleasant and I thoroughly recommend to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the heart of TST”
Reviews.Author: imartinus
Reviews.Content: Last October when I was in HK a good friend of mine was staying at the Hyatt Regency TST and invited me up to the 24th floor for a drink in the Executive lounge...at that moment I was quite impressed with the hotel, which had only recently opened for business. On my most recent trip to HK I decided to book the Hyatt and I was not disappointed! My travel agent got me a package that included breakfast, and let me tell you, they had the best chocolate croissants I've ever had in Asia! The Hyatt has a really great breakfast buffet and is a perfect start to a busy day in HK. The location is very convenient, just around the corner from Nathan Road, access to the MTR is in front of the hotel, the only thing I would improve is the hotel signage, more than once I walked pass the entrance. The hotel entrance looks like a small store front so it's easy to walk right by... Room size was just perfect, a nice change from the cramped rooms you often get in HK. The bathroom is quite modern and spacious, all in all a very comfortable stay in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at good value”
Reviews.Author: Zoglets
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a level down in cost from the top of the line hotels in HK but we believe it compares well. Our rooms faced HK Island and the views were magnificent. The room was quite spacious being a standard double. We loved the 24th floor club room access. There are drinks and snacks available all day with a light meal at supper time all at no extra cost. The decor and the ambience, down to the lounge music played, was fantastic. The view is of course is the HK Island skyline. Newspapers and magazines were available. The temp. setting was a tad low given that the weather was chilly. The service was very attentive, including placing my dirty laundry in a landry bag they provided while I was out of the room. The bathroom layout is very innovative and useful with the shower area adjacent to the bath tub, in a Japanese manner. You can't beat the convenient location, in the middle of Tsim Sha Tsui, two minutes from both Nathan Rd. and the MTR station. The one complaint we had, which is what brought the stars down from 5 to 4 was this. The windows in our room were rather dirty, ruining the view. It may have rained but the club room windows were clean during the same time. I also wish hotels at this price level provided free internet access but they don't seem to do so in HK. Overall a highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and great location”
Reviews.Author: Orang_County_greg
Reviews.Content: I love to stay in TST and this is my new default hotel... the worst part is taxi drivers have no idea how to get there but other than that 1st class all the way! I also love that it is so close to Spring Deer, best Peking Duck around, 100 yards from the hotel entrance. Great service and even though the gym wasn't done they gave me passes to Jackie Chan's California Fitness(incredible gym) I guess my biggest gripe is no free wifi, which in a hotel this pricey seems absurd...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Service”
Reviews.Author: swisssam27
Reviews.Content: must hotel for all who want to enjoy their time . service is perfect and ambiance of the hotel is outstanding. food is just excellent

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY NEW HOTEL IN HIGH TOWER GREAT VIEWS OF HARBOUR”
Reviews.Author: izzyscotlandScotland
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 nights in a beautiful Regency Club room. The Hyatt Regency occupies only part of the huge building which towers above most of the other buildings overlooking the Harbour in Kowloon, The Hotel had only been open since October so everything was fresh and new and the views from our room on the 23rd floor were amazing, at night we had a great view of the nightly lazer show over the Harbour. Everything was first class, the rooms, and the staff in the Regency Club were very friendly and professional, very well trained and made us feel very special. Definately worth upgrading to Regency Club. We would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location but somewhat of an odd layout...”
Reviews.Author: ZippyLondon
Reviews.Content: Pre-arrival: We got a cab from Kowloon Airport Express station having not known that there was a free shuttle (every 15 minutes) that drops you at this - plus a few other hotels. Cab cost $49...because we had two bags in the boot :-( Arrival at hotel: Cab drops you off in basement of hotel - very poor signage - so the driver couldn't even find the door straight away. Bag drop in basement. Up in elevator to reception. Reception: There's no real sense of arriving at The Hyatt as the layout is a bit confusing; there's no big entrance or lobby; the posh lobby along side the hotel is for the Masterpiece apartments. Check-in: Quick enough and without fuss. Room 2003 (20th floor). Room: Small room but with nice design chic (will date very quickly). Everything you could expect or want - with the exception of a bath - fine for us but I know some do like a soak. Excellent pressure in the rainfall shower. Soaked! Comfortable bed and linen. Chargeable internet if you are not plat card or above. Pool: Nice pool area but a bit tricky to get to and no, as far as I could work out, disabled access. Heated pool but weather too cool to use. Location: Great downtown location with loads of restaurants and sights near by. Lots of fake Rolex sellers and 'tailors' which can become a bit tiresome. Not scary though. Make sure you have a evening drink at the Intercontinental Hotel to see the SOL. Great service there.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and great service as always”
Reviews.Author: mysleeepy
Reviews.Content: Service is as you would expect from Hyatt, which is pretty good. This is a new building in a refurbished area of Tsim Sha Tsui, which is also one of the most tourist oriented and busy district. There's a Sky Gardent on the 9th floor with a pool and playground for the kids. Room was lovely and so was the bathroom. Too bad I forgot to take a picture. We stayed at a harbour view room and it so happened was the opening ceremony of the East Asian Game here in Hong Kong and there was a nice firework displays. Right in front of us! Be sure to ask the staff when checking in when is the latest you can check out, they would often allow later check out so that guests would not swamp to the front desk at the same time. Their buffet has some of the best dessert I've tasted in years!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Lis80
Reviews.Content: My family and I booked 3 rooms at the hotel and experienced excellent customer service as soon as we were greeted in the arrival hall in HKG airport. We had an MPV pick up at the airport for HK$800 - not bad considering we were traveling with 5 adults and an 11 month old. The driver even had a baby seat set up for us and offered us bottled water upon arrival. The hotel is about 35 minutes from the airport. Check in was a breeze and we even set up day tours when we checked in. The room is on the small side - but perfect for 2 people. The shower is awesome!! I enjoyed a long, hot, dual headed shower for the two nights I was there. The breakfast buffet was tasty. A bit pricey, but the wide variety of food was very nice. I thought the location was great. The MTR stop is right in front of the hotel, it's just two blocks from Nathan Road, and a short 15 minute walk to Kowloon Public Pier. I enjoyed my stay and so did my family members.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: AvidTraveller05
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt for 7 nights and got a very good deal on the internet, approx. US$200 per night out the door including taxes. I was happy with my stay overall. The room was on the 17th floor. I found it to be very comfortable, clean, quiet and ok sized room for one person or a couple. The breakfast buffet was good, not great - consisting of limited selection of dim sum, congee, jap breakfast, noodles, eggs, meat, fruit, yogurt/cereal, juices, etc. Since I prepaid my room, it did not come with the free buffet. I paid US$29 for the breakfast buffet which I thought was expensive. I also ordered room service and they had a VERY limited menu. Room service was expensive and in my opinion the food portion/quality was not that good. Back to the size of the room, I ordered room service and the cart could not be wheeled into the room because the room hallway is so narrow, with my lugguage blocking it. Please note at this moment, they do not have a business center. I used their internet service and paid $6 for 15 minutes of usage. They gave me a laptop and asked me to sit at the lobby bench! Service was ok - nothing great. My biggest complains and anyone looking to stay here should be wary: 1. The exterior of the hotel is still in construction! Everytime you go in and out of the hotel be prepared to breath in construction dust. It was simply a mess - road was dug up and they were putting in water pipes or something (not sure). The shopping mall that links to the hotel is still under construction. The underground transportation drop off was also in construction. I encountered some taxis and tour buses would not pick up or drop off due to the construction blockade. I was really annoyed that the hotel website did not indicate that construction was still happening. 2. The location of the hotel is convenient being near Nathan Road and few blocks from Salisbury Road. However, the hotel is in a what I call "side alley". There are transients loitering around the nearby subway stations. Being a solo traveller, I would have avoided picking this hotel if I knew of this fact.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted from the moment we checked in”
Reviews.Author: Gate73
Reviews.Content: We are just completing a four-night stay at the Hyatt Tsim Sha Tsui. We will be back! Staff could not be more pleasant or accommodating. The view of the harbor from our 20th floor room is breathtaking. When we can tear ourselves away from the window, the room awaits with comfort and convenience at every turn. Crisp sheets and a cozy duvet make the bed a treat. Lighting options abound, from the convenient desk, to the perfectly situated reading lights over the bed, to the thoughtful night light (switch controlled at bedside) for the bathroom. Complimentary toiletries are top-notch. The shower is instantly hot (with the option of both an overhead rain shower and a hand-held shower head) and the water pressure is wonderful. Towels are abundant and fluffy, and everything is cleaned to the highest standards. Elevator floor access is controlled with a wave of the guest room key, making this hotel feel especially secure. Breakfast buffet is delicious and beautifully presented, with a wide variety of hot foods, beautiful fruits and pastries, and a variety of fresh juices. Service is quietly attentive--the perfect morning start for jet-lagged guests. Buffet dinner at the hotel restaurant has cuisines from many regions--all of it high-quality and served with obvious pride in presentation. If you're looking for a "lobby scene," this is the wrong hotel. However, if what you seek is a more quiet elegance and sophistication in a convenient location, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Get a room with a view, otherwise you will stare at your neighbours”
Reviews.Author: DubaiBizTraveller
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel for a businessman or a couple who rarely spends time in the hotel but needs a very nice classy room to stay in and not pay top dollars for it. The price of the room is reasonable compared to other neighbouring 5 star hotels that have same or better quality (Grand Hyatt). But you must, at any cost, get a room with a view coz I viewed the other rooms in the hotel (including Suits) and they face other very nearby buildings and let me tell you, the view is not great at all. I loved the service, the staff were really nice and friendly. Food was OK. I took a room with a view at the club lounge level (23rd Floor). The Lounge was OK. The room had everything a businessman or couple would need including Nice Desk with Wireless and Wired Internet. And not to forget the amazing espresso machine which was really nice to be offered free of charge. The Bathroom was amazing with an open window overlooking the bedroom and overlooking the view of the harbour. Very nice at night especially if you are taking a shower and looking at the amazing view. The only not so OK thing was that you had to switch Elevators to go to the lobby level then take another elevator to the rooms floors. Oh, and there is no GYM or Pool yet as it is still under-construction, but the hotel gives you access to a nice public gym which is not a 5 star Gym but clean and you can get a decent work-out there, about 5 minutes walking distance. Some of the Hotel restaurants are not open yet, the lobby restaurant has a nice variety Buffet, so you should be ok for a meal or two. For Transportation, avoid taking Taxis if you can as traffic can be a nightmare especially during rush hour, use the Tube (Metro) which is right outside the hotel main entrance and it’s very easy to use as everything is mapped in English and the ticket system is super easy just touch your destination on the map and the fee will be displayed, pay it and here comes your ticket, it’s that simple. There are many shopping mall in the area and I recommend the Harbour City Mall which is 10 to 15 minutes walk from the Hotel. I have attached a video of the room and some picks to give you an idea. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: enr12
Reviews.Content: This hotel just opened in Oct. 2009, and replaces the old Hyatt Regency that was torn down two years ago. It is more high Tech, although the entrance is not easy to find, and the lobby is on the 6th floor. The service was good, and when I checked in on my birthday, management sent up a cake. It is a few blocks away from the former location, and not quite as convenient. The lobby is large, but with a lot of empty spaces with very few chairs to sit and relax with visitors. The security level was good as one could only get up to the rooms with a room key to work the elavator. The rooms were very clean and comfortable, although the wifi was on the high side, with a package for 3 days only, hence if you need it for 4 days it cost an additional 150HK dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and efficient service”
Reviews.Author: PALMS4EVER
Reviews.Content: We stayed for nights at the newly opened Hyatt Regency in Mody Road. The location was very convienient, with the MTR just steps outside the hotel. We visit Hongkong once a year and have been staying at different hotels but we didn't have the feeling that we would like to go back to the same hotel again. But with Hyatt Regency, the staffs made you feel welcome and they are friendly, always giving you a smile no matter if they are just holding the lift door for you. The rooms are bigger than most hotels along Tsim Sha Tsui. I can't stand rooms which are dimly lit but the rooms here are bright. The best thing is that you can also dim the reading lights if you prefer a softer light. Just outside the hotel are many restuarants so you never have to look far for something to eat. We will definitely stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was great. But a bit fishy surroundings”
Reviews.Author: MrMoopy
Reviews.Content: Stayed during the official grand opening of the hotel for 5 days. First, the good: The staff was utterly excellent in my mind, check in was fast, polite and friendly. Even bell boys were great, making sure the luggage made it quick to your room right after you check in. Totally reliable in my mind. The food at the cafe was good, whether you choose A-La Carte or Buffet. I do recommend the buffet as if was quite delicious, and the cooks there will do the cooking right in front of you and will even recommend whats good. Room was very new and clean. The room had a very good desk and chair for the business traveller who needs to work extensively. I especially liked the work chair, cause I like to slouch to work. As for the washroom, amazingly nice! Bed was pretty new and nice. Unlike some of the hotels in Hong Kong that I've stayed in, too my relief, there were no over-noisy mainland chinese guests who love to speak loudly in the corriders in the middle of the night and walk around the corridors without their shirts on (probably cause it was too new and no offense to some of you mainland chinese folks). There were also no young party go-ers coming back to the hotel late in the evening making a ruckus, so nearly every night, I had a good night's sleep. Convenient: The MTR station exit was just across the street from the hotel, but off course, the hotel is actually located in the middle between the TST MTR and East TST MTR stations, so you can either go left or go right in the underground walkway to each station. Now for the Bad Taxi drivers are completely clueless of where the hotel entrance is, since taxi's are apparently supposed to go to the underground parking to drop off and pick up passengers. Worst of all is the entrance to the hotel has double yellow lines, which mean if your car stops there, the police can ticket the driver. The Internet is quite pricey. It's not complimentary. It is quite expensive but fast. 1 day or 3 day packages. Also its for one computer to go online, not for 2 laptops in the same room. Just didnt understand why there are 3 entrances to the washroom. The normal washroom entrance door, a hidden door from the closet, and the mirror door to watch TV from the washroom. Been wondering if the hidden door from the closet is some hidden getaway if you were hiding someone from your spouse. You might think twice of the area. There are couple nightclubs on Hanoi Rd. Not the dancing kind I am talking about, but ones which you pay women for their time in a karaoke room. The parking car boys which hang out across the street for the nightclubs from the hotel are most likely Hong Kong triads, so last thing you want to do is to go offend one of them or touch one of their nice expensive cars they have parked right on Hanoi Rd at night when the their customer has gone up to the club. Otherwise my stay was quite enjoyable at the Hyatt Regency TST.

Reviews.Title: “Not Yet There”
Reviews.Author: hsav
Reviews.Content: The new hyatt regency TST just opened a couple of days before my stay. It's facilities are ok but nothing impressive compared to other hyatts in Asia or other nearby hotels. Its price is reasonable and location convenient but the hotel was really poorly designed: the car entrance is on level -3, the lobby is on level 3 and the street entrance for walk-in guests is so small that you may not find it at all. So far the hotel is lacking a gym, business center, bar and only offered a choice of 1 buffet restaurant. Furthermore the shopping mall on which the hotel stands is not open yet. If you consider staying in TST for the same price I'd recommend the langham instead for now.

Reviews.Title: “Work in Progress..Lobby on 3rd Floor !”
Reviews.Author: arcticnite
Reviews.Content: We decided to try this newly opened property. Having stayed in most of the 4+ hotels in Hong Kong; this one was attractively priced and conveniently located. The 4+ Star rating by TravelAdvisor is on the high side..First, an important aspect to any highly rate property is the ease and convenience of gaining access. We were diriven from the airport to the hotel by Hyatt's car (680 HKD). We were desposited 3 stories underground, then taken by elevator to the 3rd floor where the lobby is located. Not an impressive start. In order to get to the street level from your room, you need to reach the lobby and take another elevator the 3 floors down to street level ! One's initial impression of a property is its Lobby. Not here. You feel like you've come to a YMCA. There are just two bench style seats in the entire lobby. Enough room for about 8 people ! The rest of the space is left void of anything, save a few plants. I'm not an architect, but the design seems outrageously stupid. Clearly, they chose to locate the lobby on another floor so that street level space could be devoted to Retail. The rooms are adequate in size (for Hong Kong); but not any larger than a Super 8 in the States. All the bascis one would expect of a 4 start hotel are here, so there is nothing unique to report. Interned access is 150 HKD per 24 hour period. No iron in room, but you can request one be brought up. Two small packs of instant coffee and tea. Daily newspaper in the morning. The breakfast buffet is ok. 190 HKD/person. It is clearly not up to the standards of other highly rated hotels. Presentation is only marginal at best. There are 3 to 4 'cafeteria' style lines. More like institutional feeding, than 4 Star Hotel. Try the Shangra La for an impressive Buffet. Probably would not stay again as there are just too many better options; albiet at slightly higher cost.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: M_Teo
Reviews.Content: On arrival by taxi from the airport we were enthusistically greeted by the hyatt team who immediately opened the door of the car,handled our luggage and we were whisked to the check in desk located on another level. Already impressed by the warm greeting,we were once again make to feel very welcomed by the efficient check in staff and then personally escorted to the room by the duty manager. We headed for the lounge next and was indeed impressed that the lounge staff knew our names and we were told that we were special guests. Of course we feel honored. Our room was not that spacious though it was a suite since HK hotels generally have small rooms. My dislike was the design of the room which has the wardrobe and the bath area together. The other issue was the really hard bed. Also the pool was shared by an adjoining apartment block and guest have to bring their own towel and bath robe which i find inconvenient. My overall stay in Hyatt Regency was memorable msotly due to the management and staff who delivered the very best in terms of service.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kiranrohera
Reviews.Content: this is an new hotel good decor good rooms and good staff. but some how i dont understand or like any hotel which has a lobby on the 3rd or the 2nd floor and change 2 elevators to reach to your room .it feel more like a apartment then a hotel rest every thing is ok the lobby is small and the breakfast spread is ok not good or not bad. nothing very good about the hotel i would suggest holidayinn goldenmile is better located and bigger rooms even the lobby also langham hotel is better as all these hotels TARIFF is near about the same

Reviews.Title: “New and clean with great rooms”
Reviews.Author: eldeesilver
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night to attend a trade show. Rooms were very nice and super clean. Comfortable bed. Check in and check out went very smoothly. The location in Kowloon is a little off the beaten path on a side street. We however had no problems with the cabs finding it. The MTR is directly across the street which is very convienent for getting around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: salisbury5b
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new hotel, having opened in early October, 2009. The level of service was exceptional. Fawning might be an apt word. There must have been 3 people to clear my polates at every meal. I chose the hotel for its location in downtown Kowloon, and because I felt a new hotel might have good WiFi which could belacking in some similarly priced hotels. I chose well because the hotel is across the street from a major MTR line and minutes from the famous Nathan Road. The WiFi connection was excellent. The room isn't massive and I expect more than 2 (or 3 where the third is a young child) would find my room a bit cramped. But it was perfect for me. The bathroom and especially the shower were delightful. The hotel is located on the missle floors of a major residential highrise. The pool, which is massive, is shared with the residents. There were 4 lifeguards out there yesterday (truly incredible). The breakfast buffet was very good. There is apparently no gym (yet?) but the hotel can give you access to a nearby facility. I would stay again

HotelInfo.Name: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong Tsim Sha Tsui
HotelInfo.Address: No.18 Hanoi Road, Tsim Sha Tsui, Kowloon, Hong Kong, China
